Description: Description: Embrace the taste of a queen with our traditional English Breakfast tea. Our strong, full bodied, and highly caffeinated black tea is perfect for your energizing cup in the morning and fantastic as a pick-me-up throughout the day.  We recommended enjoying it with a splash of milk & honey or toast & jam.
Ingredients: Ingredients: Assam black tea, Indian black tea & Sikkim black tea
Name: English Breakfast

Description: Description: A soft velvety treasure. Our Silver Rose tea combines one of the rarest silver needle white tea with aromatic rose buds. The tips of the tea leaves are plucked & processed by hand in the Fujian mountains of China only a few times a year. The sweet & floral undertones arise from the rose buds, which are carefully blended in with the tea for the perfect taste and perfume. We recommend sipping hot and enjoying on its own.
Ingredients: Ingredients: Silver needle white tea & Rose buds
Name: Silver Rose

Flavor: Flavor Malty and full-bodied with lingering floral notes
Description: Our Chinese Breakfast black tea includes the flavorful golden tips of the tea leaves to create this gourmet Yunnan style of tea. It is malty and full-bodied with lingering floral notes.
Ingredients: Ingredients Verified Fair Labor™ organic Yunnan black tea.
Steeping: Brewing Instructions Steep 1 heaping tsp. tea in 12 oz. hot water for 4 minutes.
Name: Chinese Breakfast™ (loose)
Benefits: Source This tea, known as Dian Hong, is from Yunnan, China - the birthplace of tea. Many ethnic tribes in this majestic mountainous region have cultivated this tea since the Dian Dynasty.

Flavor: Flavor Bright and balanced with citrus notes
Description: We age organic Assam with real bergamot–an aromatic Italian orange–for several weeks to make this bright, balanced black tea. Each sip brings a robust flavor with subtle citrus notes.
Ingredients: Ingredients Fair Trade Certified™ organic Assam black tea, organic bergamot
Steeping: Brewing Instructions To start your day, steep 4-5 minutes. Enjoy with or without milk. For iced tea, steep 2 tea bags, cool and pour over ice.
Name: Aged Earl Grey™
Benefits: Source Our Assam black tea comes from Tonganagaon, the largest organic Fair Trade tea estate in India, where Numi's Together for H2OPE project brought clean water and sanitation to over 6,500 farmers and their families. Workers have used Fair Trade Premiums to purchase clean-burning cook stoves and food-safe aluminum containers to bring their lunches to work.

Description: We age organic Assam black tea with real Italian Bergamot so the tea absorbs the orange scent. Enjoy a robust (flavorings-free) Earl Grey with subtle citrus notes.
Ingredients: Ingredients Fair Trade Certified™ organic Assam black tea, organic bergamot.
Steeping: Brewing Instructions Steep 1 heaping tsp. tea in 12 oz. hot water for 4 minutes.
Name: Aged Earl Grey™ (loose)
Benefits: Source The workers at this organic tea estate in Assam, India have allocated their Fair Trade funds towards a new school, cooking stoves, mosquito nets and women's self-empowerment programs.

Flavor: Flavor Complex, hearty and balanced morning cup
Description: This complex blend of organic black teas – malty Assam, robust Ceylon, brisk Chinese Keemun and hints of floral Darjeeling – creates a hearty, balanced morning cup.
Ingredients: Ingredients A blend of Fair Trade Certified™ organic black teas (Assam, Ceylon, Darjeeling and Keemun).
Steeping: Brewing Instructions Steep 1 heaping tsp. tea in 12 oz. hot water for 4 minutes.
Name: Breakfast Blend (loose)
Benefits: Source This tea is sourced from Fair Trade gardens in India, Sri Lanka and China, where farmers vote on how to invest funds, empowering them to play an active role in improving their own lives.

Description: Our Golden Chai is a traditional Indian treasure. We blend organic hearty Assam black tea with organic cinnamon, cardamom and ginger for a rich and spicy tea.
Ingredients: Ingredients Fair Trade Certified™ organic Assam black tea, organic cinnamon, organic ginger, organic anise, organic cardamom
Steeping: Brewing Instructions For reviving richness, steep 4-5 minutes. Add warm milk and honey for an after-dinner treat. For iced tea, steep 2 tea bags, cool and pour over ice.
Name: Golden Chai™
Benefits: Source Our Assam black tea comes from Tonganagaon, the largest organic Fair Trade tea estate in India, where Numi's Together for H2OPE project brought clean water and sanitation to over 6,500 farmers and their families. Workers have used Fair Trade Premiums to purchase clean-burning cook stoves and food-safe aluminum containers to bring their lunches to work.

Description: This hearty blend of traditional morning teas offers an energizing start to the day. Bold and robust black teas from Assam, Ceylon, and Darjeeling create a hearty, balanced and complex cup.
Ingredients: Ingredients A blend of Fair Trade Certified™ organic black teas
Steeping: Brewing Instructions To start your day, steep 4-5 minutes. Enjoy with or without milk. For iced tea, steep 2 tea bags, cool and pour over ice.
Name: Breakfast Blend
Benefits: Source This tea is sourced from Fair Trade gardens in India and Sri Lanka, where farmers vote on how to invest funds, empowering them to play an active role in improving their own lives. Our Assam black tea comes from Tonganagaon, the largest organic Fair Trade tea estate in India, where Numi's Together for H2OPE project brought clean water and sanitation to over 6,500 farmers and their families.

Flavor: Flavor Malty and full-bodied with lingering floral notes
Description: Our Chinese Breakfast black tea includes the flavorful golden tips of the tea leaves to create this gourmet Yunnan style of tea. It is malty and full-bodied with lingering floral notes. What distinguishes this tea from others is its perfect balance, tiger's eye color, and a vibrancy which makes it suitable for any time of day.
Ingredients: Ingredients Verified Fair Labor™ organic Yunnan black tea
Steeping: Brewing Instructions To start your day, steep 4-5 minutes. Enjoy with or without milk. For iced tea, steep 2 tea bags, cool and pour over ice.
Name: Chinese Breakfast™
Benefits: Source Yunnan, China is known as the birthplace of tea. Many ethnic tribes in this majestic mountainous region have cultivated tea since the Dian Dynasty (279-107 BCE). Our Verified Fair Labor™ program in Yunnan ensures fair wages, overtime pay, safe working conditions, and benefits like maternity leave for workers.

Caffeine: Brewing Instructions Single one-gallon batches: Place one bag of High Mountain Black™ in a clean gallon container. Bring two quarts of fresh water to a boil. Pour over bag and let steep 6-8 minutes. Gently squeeze bag to release all flavor and discard bag. Add two quarts cold water or four quarts ice. Serve High Mountain Black™ chilled with ice. Enjoy!
Description: This gallon size iced tea pouch contains the finest whole leaf, single-estate back tea leaves. Making at-home brewing easy, it brews to an amber liquor low in astringency, rich in flavor and clean on the palate.
Ingredients: null
Name: High Mountain Black Ice™

Flavor: Brewing Instructions Single one-gallon batches: Place one bag of Classic Black in a clean gallon container. Bring two quarts of fresh water to a boil. Pour over bag and let steep 6-8 minutes. Gently squeeze bag to release all flavor and discard bag. Add two quarts cold water or four quarts ice. Serve Classic Black chilled with ice. Enjoy!

Ingredients: null

Steeping: Brewing Instructions Steep 1 heaping tsp. tea in 12 oz. hot water for 4 minutes.
Name: Golden Chai™ (loose)
Benefits: Source The workers at this organic tea estate in Assam, India, have allocated their Fair Trade funds towards school scholarships, new roads, mosquito nets and women's self-empowerment programs.

Flavor: Flavor Sweet & aromatic with bright floral notes
Description: Fragrant organic jasmine flowers are laid atop organic green tea leaves as their scent is naturally embraced. Scented three times, this smooth green tea has layers of subtle fragrance and hints of moonlight.
Ingredients: Ingredients Fair Trade Certified™ organic green tea scented with organic jasmine flowers.
Steeping: Brewing Instructions Steep 1 heaping tsp. tea in 12 oz. hot water for 2 minutes.
Name: Jasmine Green (loose)
Benefits: Source Our jasmine green tea is sourced from the first Fair Trade gardens in China where workers' wages have increased 30 - 40% and premiums recently funded the school dormitory for children.

Description: This rich and invigorating blend grounds the body and uplifts the spirit. We combine bright, refreshing lemongrass with warming ginger root for soothing comfort. Our green tea is decaffeinated by a revolutionary organic CO2 process called ""Effervescence."" It is the only chemical-free method that does not extract the flavor or antioxidants inherent in green tea.
Ingredients: Ingredients Fair Trade Certified™ organic ginger, Fair Trade Certified™ organic decaf green tea, organic lemongrass, organic licorice, organic lemon verbena, organic lemon myrtle
Steeping: Brewing Instructions For ease and balance, steep 3-4 minutes. For iced tea, steep 2 tea bags, cool and pour over ice.
Name: Ginger Lemon
Benefits: Source Our Fair Trade Certified™ green tea comes from the Dooars region of India, near the foothills of the Himalayas. The farmers at this tea garden use organic, biodynamic and climate-sensitive practices to restore the surrounding ecosystem and water table. Community members benefit from investments in education, entrepreneurship training, healthcare facilities, and clean water systems.

Description: Within hours of being plucked, this organic green tea is gently rolled into small tight pearls on a wok, then custom crafted for Numi’s tea bags. This process preserves its smooth, full-bodied flavor and delicate aroma for far longer than other green teas.
Ingredients: Ingredients Fair Trade Certified™ organic green tea
Steeping: Brewing Instructions To enrich well-being, steep 2-3 minutes. For iced tea, steep 2 tea bags, cool and pour over ice.
Name: Gunpowder Green
Benefits: Source Our Gunpowder Green tea is sourced from the first Fair Trade garden in China, where workers’ wages have increased 30-40% from tea sales. Fair Trade funds are provided to each family to support their children’s enrollment in highschool and universities.

Description: We scent fragrant, smooth green tea leaves three times with night-blooming jasmine to make this delicate tea. In Jiangxi Province, China, rich soil and fluctuations in daily temperature yield a fragrant leaf. Jasmine flowers gently cover the tea until their scent is fully absorbed.
Ingredients: Ingredients Fair Trade Certified™ organic green tea scented with organic jasmine flowers
Steeping: Brewing Instructions For sweet balance, steep 2-3 minutes. For iced tea, steep 2 tea bags, cool and pour over ice.
Name: Jasmine Green
Benefits: Source Our Jasmine Green tea is sourced from the first Fair Trade garden in China, where workers’ wages have increased 30-40% from tea sales. Fair Trade funds are provided to each family to support their children’s enrollment in highschool and universities.

Description: A legendary South American elixir, this infusion of organic Brazilian Yerba Mate, Australian Lemon Myrtle and green tea unfolds into a lemon taste with sweet, earthy undertones. Its stimulating effect evokes a cheerful mental lucidity.
Ingredients: Ingredients Organic yerba mate, organic lemon myrtle, Fair Trade Certified™ organic green tea
Steeping: Brewing Instructions To enliven and refresh, steep 3-4 minutes. For iced tea, steep 2 tea bags, cool and pour over ice.
Name: Mate Lemon
Benefits: Source Our organic yerba mate comes from Paraná, Brazil. Sustainably grown mate provides a bounty of ecosystem and community benefits, including carbon sequestration, biodiversity, and forest restoration. Because yerba is more profitable to grow than cattle or destructive monocrops, farmers make better wages while preserving endangered forest habitats.

Description: Within hours of being plucked, this whole leaf organic green tea is gently steamed and then rolled into small tight pearls. When steeped, the leaves unfurl, releasing a well-rounded, full-bodied flavor.
Ingredients: Ingredients Fair Trade Certified™ organic green tea.
Steeping: Brewing Instructions Steep 1 heaping tsp. tea in 12 oz. hot water for 2 minutes.
Name: Gunpowder Green (loose)
Benefits: Source Our organic green tea is harvested by the Tuija people of Enshi, China. Since becoming Fair Trade in 2006, they have built new roads and a hospital, and their whole wages have increased.

Flavor: Flavor Sweet & aromatic with bright floral notes
Description: The most tender green tea leaves are hand rolled into small pearls and scented with fresh jasmine blossoms. The fragrant flowers are mated five times with the tea according to traditional tea scenting techniques that date back over nine centuries. This high quality jasmine tea from Fujian Province has a sweet aromatic flavor with bright floral notes.
Ingredients: Ingredients Fair Trade Certified™ organic green tea scented with organic jasmine flowers.
Steeping: Brewing Instructions Steep 1 heaping tsp. tea in 12 oz. hot water for 2 minutes.
Name: Jasmine Pearls (loose)

Description: A classic blend of genmaicha and matcha teas, Matcha Toasted Rice has a savory, nutty flavor. We blend sencha green tea with toasted rice to make Genmaicha, a traditional Japanese tea. The result is a smooth, rich brew with earthy depth and undertones of brightness.
Ingredients: Ingredients Verified Fair Labor™ organic sencha green tea, organic toasted rice, Verified Fair Labor™ organic matcha
Steeping: Brewing Instructions To boost well-being, steep 2-3 minutes. For iced tea, steep 2 tea bags, cool and pour over ice.
Name: Matcha Toasted Rice
Benefits: Source The organic sencha and matcha teas in this blend come from a single Verified Fair Labor™ farm in Zhejiang, China, where investments in worker health and safety ensure fair working conditions.

Description: Immune Support tea blends elderberry, elderflower, ginger, rosehip, lemongrass & thyme for a sweet & herbaceous cold and flu season tea that supports immunity and the respiratory system.*
Ingredients: Ingredients Organic Elderflower, organic elderberry fruit, organic Fair Trade Certified™ ginger root, organic rosehip fruit, organic lemongrass stalk, organic thyme leaf
Steeping: Brewing Instructions Support your immunity. Steep 8-10 minutes.
Name: Immune Support
Origin: Source Numi uses only pure ingredients, no compromise. This potent botanical blend is made with 100% real, non-GMO organic herbs, roots, spices and flowers—never any added flavorings or artificial fragrances.
Benefits: Why it Works Elderflower & elderberry (Sambucus nigra) strengthen the respiratory system and enhance immune response. Rosehips (Rosa canina), are sweet red berries that pack a bright burst of citric replenishment. Thyme (Thymus vulgaris) is an aromatic herb that warms and soothes the respiratory system.*.

Description: Throat Soother tea blends sage, licorice root, marshmallow root, cinnamon & clove for a comforting cold and flu season tea.*
Ingredients: Ingredients Organic sage leaf, organic licorice root, organic marshmallow root, organic cinnamon bark, organic clove bud
Steeping: Brewing Instructions Soothe and savor. Steep 8-10 minutes.
Name: Throat Soother
Origin: Source Numi uses only pure ingredients, no compromise. This potent botanical blend is made with 100% real, non-GMO organic herbs, roots, spices and flowers—never any added flavorings or artificial fragrances.
Benefits: Why it Works Marshmallow root (Althaea officinalis L.) is used historically to moisten and ease sore, dry throat. Licorice root (Glycyrrhiza glabra L.), is traditionally used to help sore throats due to its demulsifying properties. Sage (Salvia officinalis L.) provides aromatherapy in your cup to ground and clear.*

Description: Immune Boost tea blends echinacea, dandelion root, dandelion leaf, rosehip, ginger, cinnamon & licorice for a potent & efficacious cold and flu season tea that supports immunity and rejuvenates vital organs.*
Ingredients: Ingredients Organic echinacea leaf & stem, organic rosehip fruit, organic dandelion root, organic dandelion leaf & stem, organic ginger root, organic cinnamon bark, organic licorice root
Steeping: Brewing Instructions Boost your system. Steep 8-10 minutes.
Name: Immune Boost
Origin: SourceNumi uses only pure ingredients, no compromise. This potent botanical blend is made with 100% real, non-GMO organic herbs, roots, spices and flowers—never any added flavorings or artificial fragrances.
Benefits: Why it Works Echinacea (Echinacea purpurea), native to North America, is a powerful ally in immune defense. Rosehips (Rosa canina), are sweet red berries that pack a bright burst of citric replenishment. Dandelion leaf & root (Taraxaci officinales) are known to tonify and rejuvenate.*

Description: Congest Away tea blends licorice root, fennel seed, peppermint, ginger & cinnamon for a cooling & soothing brew that supports respiratory health.*
Ingredients: Ingredients Organic Fair Trade Certified™ fennel seed, organic peppermint leaf, organic Fair Trade Certified™ ginger root, organic cinnamon bark, organic licorice root
Steeping: Brewing Instructions Sip and breath deep. Steep 8-10 minutes.
Name: Congest Away
Origin: Source Numi uses only pure ingredients, no compromise. This potent botanical blend is made with 100% real, non-GMO organic herbs, roots, spices and flowers—never any added flavorings or artificial fragrances.
Benefits: Why it Works Peppermint (Mentha piperita L.) from North America, has a high menthol content, which is cooling and refreshing. This sweet Egyptian variety of Fennel (Foeniculum vulgare) is a naturally soothing herbal remedy. Ginger (Zingiber officinale Roscoe) is spicy, invigorating and warm with stimulating properties..

Description: Dandelion Detox tea blends dandelion root, dandelion leaf, nettle, burdock root, red clover, milk thistle, lemon peel, cardamom & lemon myrtle for a purifying & detoxifying brew.*
Ingredients: Ingredients Organic dandelion root, organic dandelion leaf, organic nettle leaf, organic burdock root, organic red clover herb, organic milk thistle seed, organic lemon peel, organic cardamom pod, organic lemon myrtle leaf
Steeping: Brewing Instructions Nurture and purify. Steep 8-10 minutes.
Name: Dandelion Detox
Origin: Source Numi uses only pure ingredients, no compromise. This potent botanical blend is made with 100% real, non-GMO organic herbs, roots, spices and flowers—never any added flavorings or artificial fragrances.
Benefits: Why it Works Dandelion leaf & root (Taraxacum officinale) tonifies and rejuvenates while supporting vitality and energy. Nettle (Urticae folia) is known to bolster and balance the system. Milk thistle (Silybum marianum), with rich Chinese & Western herbal traditions, supports healthy liver function.*

Description: Sweet Slumber features a dreamy blend of herbs, chamomile, and potent valerian root that relieves stress and inspires rest and relaxation. The combination of pro-sleep and anti-anxiety herbal ingredients creates a calming bedtime experience.
Ingredients: Ingredients Fair Trade Certified™ organic chamomile flowers (Matricaria recutita), organic lavender flower (Lavandula angustifolia), organic lemon balm leaf (Melissa officinalis), organic licorice root (Glycyrrhiza glabra), organic valerian root (Valeriana edulis), organic passionflower (Passiflora incarnata), organic hop flowers (Humulus lupulus)
Steeping: Brewing Instructions To unwind and drift off, steep 8-10 minutes.
Name: Sweet Slumber
Origin: Source The chamomile in Sweet Slumber comes from Numi's Fair Trade partners in Faiyum, Egypt, along the banks of the Nile River. Fair Trade certification has provided our partners at the Sakaran cooperative with funds to purchase a school bus to help transport children to school.

Passionflower (Passiflora incarnata), our purple beauty, is known to reduce stress and mild anxiety*. Hop Flowers (Humulus lupulus) ease the nervous system and occasional sleeplessness*.

Description: A cousin of the rooibos plant, honeybush is a flowering shrub that yields a rich, earthy brew with honey overtones. This sweet South African nectar is naturally caffeine free.
Ingredients: Ingredients Organic honeybush
Steeping: Brewing Instructions To enrich well-being, steep 5-6 minutes. Enjoy with or without milk. For iced tea, steep 2 tea bags, cool and pour over ice.
Name: Honeybush
Benefits: Source Numi introduced organic wild-harvested honeybush to the U.S. in 1999. Since then, locals have sustainably harvested this plant as a significant source of income for their communities. We selectively source from tea farms with conservation management plans, rather than from public lands, where overharvesting is a chronic problem. The honeybush plant is integral to the fynbos region of South Africa, which has one of the most diverse and rarified plant communities in the world.

Description: Our soothing Moroccan Mint, known as ""nana mint,"" flourishes in North Africa. Light and lively as a newly picked leaf, its sweet spearmint flavor is refreshing any time of day.

Name: Moroccan Mint
Benefits: Source Our special ""nana mint"" grows in the arid climate of Faiyum, Egypt, where Numi’s Fair Trade Certified partners plan to invest in schools, sanitation and a bus to transport workers.

Flavor: Flavor Sweet brew imparts citrus murmurings
Description: We combine fine Egyptian chamomile blossoms with Australian lemon myrtle leaves for a sweet organic brew that imparts a lingering calmness with citrus murmurings.

Description: We infuse mellow rooibos with warming spices like cinnamon, ginger, cloves, and cardamom for a sweet release. This sultry, caffeine-free chai is the perfect after-dinner treat. Also called “red tea,” rooibos has a deep, earthy vanilla taste, and is known for its calming effects.

With support from Numi's Verified Fair Labor™ program, the workers at this farm formed an association to deliver community benefits like meals for local preschools and senior centers, basic standard-of-living upgrades, solar water heaters, and a mobile optometry clinic.

Flavor: Flavor Smooth and earthy, with an apple-like taste and spicy finish
Description: Earthy, complex and calming, our Tulsi tea is infused with licorice, ashwagandha, turmeric, maca and chamomile. Also known as “holy basil,” tulsi is an ancient medicinal plant that has been used in India for over 5,000 years. It has a light lemon scent with a peppery floral aftertaste. Licorice invigorates the spirit, while ashwagandha, referred to as “Indian ginseng,” promotes vitality and calm.
Ingredients: Ingredients Organic tulsi, organic lemon verbena, organic licorice, organic turmeric, organic chamomile, organic rose, organic nettle, organic ashwagandha, organic echinacea root, organic maca, organic clove, organic damiana
Steeping: Brewing Instructions To enrich well-being, steep 8-10 minutes.
Name: Tulsi
Benefits: Gratitude Practice (10 minutes daily) Find a quiet space and time to sit in ease. Relax your body, gently close your eyes and slow your breathing, paying attention to the rise and fall of your belly as you inhale and exhale. Acknowledge something you are grateful for, like your family. As you bring up the gratitude, feel into the positive blessings. Bring up people in your family sphere and offer blessings of well-being to them. Repeat with other things you are grateful for.

Description: Traditionally harvested and dried in the hot desert sun, this rare Arabian dried lime has been drunk for centuries in the Middle East. It has a distinct, tart citrus flavor and is an oasis of health. We named our company Numi after this drink, which our founders enjoyed as children.
Ingredients: Ingredients Fair Trade Certified™ organic dried lime.
Steeping: Brewing Instructions For a potent citrus cup, steep 3-4 minutes. For iced tea, steep 2 tea bags, cool and pour over ice.
Name: Dry Desert Lime™
Benefits: Source Our Fair Trade Certified™ dried lime is grown in Burkina Faso, West Africa.

Flavor: Flavor Rich and earthy with soft apple notes

Benefits: Source From its beginnings in 1999, Numi has worked with the same small-scale, organic rooibos farm in the Cederberg region of South Africa. Numi Foundation's Together for H2OPE initiative brought running water to workers' houses at this farm for the first time. The farm uses innovative farming methods to integrate patches of wild landscape into cultivated areas, protecting the biodiversity and overall health of the landscape.

A bouquet of flowers – sensual hibiscus, soothing lavender, calming chamomile and the afterglow of rose – enhance with a bright floral aroma. Limeflower adds a bright juiciness while cinnamon and cloves bring a warm spark as mind and heart connect in this dreamy blend.

Flavor: Flavor Bright savory taste, followed by a lingering sweetness
Description: A way of tea unique to Japan, matcha is a shade-grown green tea ground into a fine powder. An antioxidant powerhouse, matcha drinkers benefit from ingesting the whole leaf rather than the brewed leaves. Sourced directly from a family grower located in Shizuoka, Japan, Numi’s Ceremonial Matcha is of the highest quality and has a bright savory taste, followed by a lingering sweetness. The prized Samidori tea leaves are covered prior to harvest to increase the chlorophyll content, which develops a classic bright green color and full, vibrant flavor.
Ingredients: Ingredients Organic matcha green tea
Name: Ceremonial Matcha

Flavor: Flavor Bold and earthy with hints of malt
Description: Puerh (pū-ĕr) is an ancient healing tea known for its medicinal properties and rich taste. Numi’s organic pu∙erh comes from 500-year-old, wild tea trees grown in China’s Yunnan Mountains. Unlike traditional teas that are oxidized over an 8-hour period, pu∙erh undergoes a unique 60-day fermentation process resulting in a bold, earthy flavor with hints of malt. This rich, energizing tea is deeply satisfying as a coffee alternative.
Ingredients: Ingredients Verified Fair Labor™ organic black pu∙erh tea
Steeping: Brewing Instructions To awaken and restore, steep 4-5 minutes. Enjoy with or without milk. For iced tea, steep 2 tea bags, cool and pour over ice.
Name: Emperor's Pu·erh
Benefits: Source These old-growth, rare pu∙erh trees are communally owned by the residents of the local villages in the Yunnan Mountains, ensuring a stable source of income for generations to come. The tea trees are grown in harmony with the primary indigenous forest, promoting biodiversity and forest conservation in the region. Numi's Fair Labor Verification program in Yunnan has invested in improving maternity benefits for factory workers, and bettering workplace health and safety conditions.

Unlike traditional teas that are oxidized for 8 hours, Pu∙erh undergoes a unique 60-day fermentation process resulting in a bold, earthy flavor with hints of malt. Pu∙erh is compressed into bricks and aged, like fine wine, for months, years or even decades. This increases its value and rich taste.

Steeping: Brewing Instructions Break off 1 square portion and place in a 10 oz. teapot. Pu•erh should be rinsed before steeping to awaken the sleeping leaves: pour boiling water to fill the pot halfway, swirl for several seconds and pour out the water. Fill the teapot and place a lid on the top; steep to desired strength, or 2 minutes. Strain into your cup or a serving pitcher and enjoy! Each portion may be steeped 4 times. Description:
Andean Tulsi and Second Flush Darjeeling tea create a unique dynamic in this special blend.

Tulsi, or as it is nicknamed, the ""Queen of Herbs,"" is one of the cornerstones of the Ayurvedic tradition. Ayurveda, translating from Sanskrit as ""the Science of Life,"" is a healing science originating in India over 5,000 years ago. Ayurveda's main principles promote health through balance--balanced mind, diet, lifestyle and application of herbs. Tulsi is renowned for its calming effect, offering cognitive and memory-enhancing properties.

Set high in the Himalayas, Darjeeling is cherished by connoisseurs for yielding teas of extraordinary aromatic depth with each garden has a signature aroma profile. The second flush is treasured for ripened notes of stone fruits and features a lovely orange-red infusion.

This blend is energized by the tea, structured by tannins, and uplifted by Andean tulsi. The synergistic benefits of l-theanine in tea and Ocimumosides A and B found in tulsi are responsible for the nootropic enhancing effects of the blend.

Learn more about Tulsi - The Queen of Herbs.
Ingredients: null
Name: Himalayan Tulsi

Flavor: Extraordinarily floral with iris, orchid, nectarine and lily of the valley
Description:
Origin: Tumsong Garden, Darjeeling, India
Cultivar: Ambari Vegetative 2 & Original China Bush
Elevation: 1500m
Harvest: March 22, 2021

Set high in the Himalayas, Darjeeling is cherished by connoisseurs for yielding teas of extraordinary aromatic depth. The Tumsong estate was planted in 1867 on slopes that face the highest Himalayan ranges and are met with constant cold winds. This weather created by the expansive mountain range causes the tea to grow gradually. This slow development concentrates the leaves with the garden’s signature floral and fruity aromas. The eagerly anticipated First Flush harvest in March-April produces teas with a brilliant golden infusion that captures the essence of spring. This lot from the Tumsong garden is extraordinarily floral with iris, orchid, nectarine and lily of the valley. This tea has an amazing bouquet and presence.
Ingredients: Organic black tea
Name: Darjeeling First Flush Tumsong EX3

Flavor: Fresh florals including a distinct lily of the valley note, Lan Hua and layered balance of challenging tannin, aroma and umami
Description:
Origin: Ramché, Nigalé, Bokré & Chulachuli Divisions, Jun Chiyabari, Hile, Nepal
Cultivar: Phoobsering 312, Takdah 78, Takdah 668 and Bannockburn 157
Elevation: 1850m
Harvest: April 4, 2021

Jun Chiyabari is located in Hile, a region nestled in the Himalayas in eastern Nepal, due south of Mt. Everest with stunning views of Kangchenjunga. Himalayan Spring is a lightly oxidized black tea, crafted by skillful withering, delicate Britannia rolling, and gentle oven baking. The cool, Springtime temperatures at high elevation in the Himalayas inhibits tea leaf oxidation, so while Himalayan Spring is technically a black tea you will notice the leaves are pear green in color. This style of tea is made only in spring and since 2011 our partners have captured the freshness, new life and youthfulness of the season with well-timed harvests and gentle handling, maximizing the fresh, flowery and fruity characters. Lot J9 possesses fresh florals including a distinct lily of the valley note, Lan Hua and a layered balance of challenging tannin, aroma and umami —a bright and lively Himalayan Spring at its best.
Ingredients: Organic black tea
Name: Himalayan Spring J9

Flavor: Rich and malty with a smooth, sweet vanilla finish
Description: Decadent and creamy, this is the ultimate vanilla forward black tea. We blend a malty, smooth-bodied tea from Yunnan with premium vanilla and high quality chopped vanilla bean to create a silky, layered taste experience. Our Vanilla Bean is cured before release for a harmonized and integrated flavor.
Ingredients: Organic black tea, organic vanilla bean, natural vanilla flavor
Name: Vanilla Bean

Flavor: grape Muscatel, floral notes of iris and aromas of peach
Description:
Origin: Garden, Darjeeling, India
Cultivar: China variety & Bannockburn 157
Elevation: 1525 meters
Harvest: June 6, 2021

Set high in the Himalayas, Darjeeling is cherished by connoisseurs for yielding teas of extraordinary aromatic depth. Many of the gardens from which we source our teas were founded in the 19th century. While cultivar selection is a factor, the real complexity of Darjeeling teas is to be explored in the diversity of terrain in the gardens. The range in elevation, the pitch of the slope and the amount of sun exposure lead to distinctive differences in character. Each garden has a signature aroma profile. While the first flush produces greenish-golden teas with a tight structure and floral bouquet, the second flush is treasured for more ripened notes of fruits and features a lovely orange-red infusion. The dried leaves feature both chunky tips and buds. In this lot from the Tumsong in the Golden Valley, we are tasting grape Muscatel, floral notes of iris and aromas of peach.
Ingredients: Organic black tea
Name: Darjeeling Second Flush Tumsong EX6

Description: Do you love your chai hot and extra spicy? Spicy Masala Chai is designed for you. We added cayenne chili flakes in addition to a double concentration of ginger to deliver a thoroughly warming chai experience. Classic aromatic accents of cloves, cinnamon and cardamom add rich depth.
Ingredients: organic cardamom, organic ginger root, organic cinnamon, organic black tea, organic black pepper, organic cloves, organic chili flakes, essential ginger oil
Name: Spicy Masala Chai

Flavor: Wild Thai Black has energy and heft with aromatic notes of ripe pit fruits, Bing cherry, hints of graham cracker and a tinge of cassia.
Description: Wild Thai Black is an exciting addition to our collection of single-origin black teas. Hailing from a remote mountainous region in northern Thailand, where the growing conditions are truly wild, this ancient forest tea presents an impressive strength and rich flavor. The complex tannic structure and phenolic density of these old roots tea trees provide a bold body and robust ruby red infusion. With its rich vivacity and robust, malty character, Wild Thai Black offers a far more rustic and adventurous black tea experience than the common (and easily accessed) colonial heritage teas from Assam, Darjeeling, or Ceylon.
Ingredients: Organic black tea
Name: Wild Thai Black

Ingredients: null
Name: Hong Yun #21-GD21

Flavor: Rare cultivar black tea offering a stimulating energy with aromas of white grape skin and wild rose and lingering hints of violet
Description:
Origin: Wa Shan, Cangyuan County, Yunnan Province, China
Cultivar: 紫娟 Zi Juan “Purple Beauty”
Elevation: 1,850m
Harvest Date: March 27- April 11th, 2021

Yunnan Purple Buds is a black tea made from a rare purple leaf tea cultivar called Zi Juan, or ""Purple Beauty."" Zi Juan produces beautiful reddish-purple leaves that are high in anthocyanins, a family of red and blue antioxidants found in fruits like blueberries, blackcurrants, Concord grapes, and bilberries. In recent years, Zi Juan has become a popular tea in China as a unique source for these healthful pigments. Yunnan Purple Buds is grown in a biodiverse and exceptionally well-managed organic tea garden in Wa Shan, a lush mountainous region of southwestern Yunnan named after the Wa ethnic minority group who calls it home.
Ingredients: Organic black tea
Name: Yunnan Purple Buds
Origin: Wa Shan, Cangyuan county, Yunnan province, China

Flavor: Robust body that is bold but smooth with a sweet peppery note and slight aroma of wintergreen
Description:
Origin: Wa Shan, Cangyuan county, Yunnan province, China
Cultivar:  Zi Juan 紫娟 “Purple Beauty”
Elevation: 1,850m
Harvest: April 1-15, 2021

Yunnan Sun-dried Purple Tea was made from a rare purple leaf tea cultivar called Zi Juan, or ""Purple Beauty."" This microlot was processed like shaiqing—the base of all Pu’er teas. Zi Juan is typically used as a black tea cultivar and produces beautiful reddish-purple leaves that are high in anthocyanins, a family of red and blue hued polyphenols found in fruits like blueberries, blackcurrants, Concord grapes and bilberries. In recent years, Zi Juan has risen in popularity in China as a unique source for these healthful pigments. Our 2021 selection of this special sun-dried lot uses traditional methods which harness the energy of the sun during processing and has a robust body that is bold but smooth with a sweet peppery note and slight aroma of wintergreen, grapes and hops.
Ingredients: Organic sun-dried black tea
Name: Yunnan Sun-dried Purple Tea
Origin: Wa Shan, Cangyuan county, Yunnan province, China

Flavor: Brisk and malty black tea with lofty rose notes
Description:
Luxuriate in the aromas of rose in this premium black tea offering. Our top grade of Yunnan Dianhong black tea is scented with red roses in Yunnan featuring an addition of Moroccan rose petals, blended in-house. The black tea is masterfully processed to achieve a rich auburn color flecked with golden buds, highlighted by the pinkish-red hued petals. The elegant tannin structure of the tea is further uplifted with the intoxicating scent of rose.  
 
Morocco is renowned throughout the world as one of the premiere origins of roses, while Yunnan China, is heralded as the birthplace of tea. This propriety blend is delightful when served straight and divine with milk and sugar or prepared as a milk tea. The combination delivers a sumptuous cup, perfect to gift to a loved one or to yourself.
Ingredients: Organic black tea, organic rose petals
Name: Rose-scented Dianhong Black Tea
Origin: Wa Shan, Cangyuan county, Yunnan province, China

Flavor: Malty and rich with a mellow,  jammy sweetness and subtle  accents of plum and raisin
Description: Our finest grade of Dianhong black tea, harvested from Mengku heirloom varietal tea trees in China's southwestern Yunnan Province, the birthplace of tea. Masterfully oxidized into an auburn color flecked with golden buds, this black tea has an impressive strength, density and refined finish. Golden Yunnan has a richly textured infusion that offers hints of peppery spice, notes of chocolate and sweet lychee with a deep malty finish. This top-shelf black tea is delightful when served straight, and divine with milk and sugar.
Ingredients: Organic black tea
Name: Golden Yunnan

Flavor: A full-bodied and smooth  breakfast blend with hints of  sweet caramel and spice
Description: Our signature breakfast tea is a tippy Dian Hong growing between 1,600 - 1,800 meters in elevation at the densely forested Wa Shan Ecological Tea Garden in Yunnan. China Breakfast is beloved for its mellow character and hints of sweet caramel and raisin. Milder than English Breakfast, this tea presents a deep red infusion that is smooth enough to enjoy on its own or exquisite with milk and honey.
Ingredients: Organic black tea
Name: China Breakfast

Flavor: Smooth and lively with the unique citrusy, floral aroma of bergamot oranges
Description:
A British tea classic, Earl Grey is the most widely enjoyed black tea blend in the world. Earl Grey dates back to the nineteenth century tea trade when Charles Grey, the 2nd Earl Grey, was presented with a gift of Taitaicha—tea scented with citrus blossoms—during his travels in Canton. After Grey returned home, his namesake tea became wildly popular when the tea salons of Europe infused black teas with the essence of the bergamot citrus fruit that grows in Reggio Di' Calabria, Italy. Our organic Earl Grey combines robust and fruity Thai black tea with mellow, caramel sweet Yunnan Dian Hong. This original blend perfectly complements the floral high notes of geranium and rose found in our first-pressing bergamot essential oil.

On the go? Check out our Earl Grey Tea Bags.
Ingredients: Organic black tea, essential bergamot oil
Name: Earl Grey

Flavor: Lively, robust red cup with a brisk flavor and notes of dates and raisins.
Description:
Our English Breakfast highlights teas from Southeast Asia to produce Rishi's signature profile blend. The origins will vary from time to time, but the blend is always honed to brew consistently. Currently, the origins are Yunnan, Myanmar and Assam.

Our English Breakfast has a rich red infusion color that is malty and robust with sweet, chocolatey undertones and a brisk body that can stand up to milk and sugar. By comparison, our China Breakfast is intended to be more mellow, caramel-sweet and is designed to be smooth enough to drink straight up without milk and sugar.

On the go? Check out our English Breakfast Tea Bags.
Ingredients: Organic black tea
Name: English Breakfast

Flavor: classic Muscatel, magnolia, wintergreen, Natal plum flowers and honey wine
Description:
Origin: Pussimbing Garden, Darjeeling, India
Cultivar: Original China Bush
Elevation: 1300-1800m
Harvest: March 24, 2021

Set high in the Himalayas, Darjeeling is cherished by connoisseurs for yielding teas of extraordinary aromatic depth. The Pussimbing Garden is organic certified and features beautiful natural flora in addition to the cultivated tea plants. The name Pussimbing translates as “full of natural streams,” and the garden certainly lives up to its name. The garden sits at a lofty elevation and frequently misted in fog, which contributes to its highly aromatic teas. The eagerly anticipated First Flush harvest in March-April produces teas with a brilliant golden infusion that captures the essence of spring. This lot from the high altitude, 120-year-old Pussimbing Garden is extraordinary with flavors of classic Muscatel, magnolia, wintergreen, natal plum flowers and honey wine. This is an amazing and classic Darjeeling offering.
Ingredients: Organic black tea
Name: Darjeeling First Flush Pussimbing DJ5

Flavor: Caramelized brown sugar, sansho leaf, black date, plum, chocolate, leather
Description:
Origin: Wa Shan, Cangyuan county, Yunnan province, China
Cultivar: Mengku Da Ye Yunnan broad leaf
Elevation: 1600m-1820m
Harvest: March 20 – April 10, 2021

Our selection of Golden Buds feature single-bud plucks from the Mengku Da Ye Broad Leaf tea variety of Yunnan and is expertly oxidized according to wrapped-pile oxidation tactics developed in the 1950’s. This is an amazing quality of premium black tea with a unique flavor performance and pristine appearance. Yunnan Dian Hong Golden Buds is an excellent tea for brewing in the Gongfu style, using a Gaiwan to capture and savor the lingering, caramelized sweetness that this tea has to offer.

Yunnan Dian Hong Golden Buds is grown in a biodiverse and exceptionally well-managed organic tea garden in Wa Shan, a lush mountainous region of southwestern Yunnan named after the Wa ethnic minority group who calls it home.
Ingredients: Organic black tea
Name: Yunnan Dian Hong Golden Buds
Origin: Wa Shan, Cangyuan county, Yunnan province, China

Flavor: Enchanting lavender perfectly  complements the floral aromas  and citrus notes of Earl Grey
Description: Earl Grey Lavender combines the enchanting fragrance of organic lavender blossoms with the stimulating citrusy scent of bergamot pressed from real fruit and flowers. With its soothing perfume and smooth taste, this exquisite blend makes a perfect pairing with freshly baked scones or cakes for an authentic afternoon tea.
Ingredients: Organic black tea, organic lavender flowers, essential bergamot oil, natural lavender extract
Name: Earl Grey Lavender

Flavor: Refreshing citrus and zesty spicy ginger with tropical hints of juicy mango and turmeric.
Description: Lemon Ginger combines a bold and caramel-sweet black tea with zesty spicy ginger, pungent turmeric, juicy mango and a burst of stimulating lemon. The balancing energy of these botanicals makes Lemon Ginger a perfect traveler's tea.
Ingredients: Organic ginger root, organic black tea, organic lemon peel, organic mango, organic turmeric root, organic licorice root, organic lemongrass, essential lemon, lime and ginger oils
Name: Lemon Ginger

Flavor: Luxardo cherry, aged tawny port, and pine resin.
Description:
Origin: Mingjian Village, Taiwan
Cultivar: TTES #21 ""Hong Yun"" (Indian Assam x Keemun)
Elevation: 500m
Harvest: September 10, 2021

The Hong Cha grown in the Mingjian Village are supremely special black teas. Grown from cultivars catalogued in the Taiwan Tea Research and Extension Station registry by the Taiwanese government, these teas are truly notable and famous for their distinct characteristics. Hong Yun 21 is a unique tea cultivar grown in Taiwan to produce high-end black teas of exceptional aromatic complexity and rich mouthfeel. Hong Yun #21 紅韻translates to “red charm,” which refers to its vibrant red color and the pleasing effect of its elegantly brisk structure. It is a cross-breed of Keemun (Original Qi Men small-leaf tea from Anhui) and Indian Kyang variety registered in 2008.
Ingredients: null
Name: Hong Yun #21

Flavor: Rich, smooth black tea with the lofty floral and citrusy high notes of Italian bergamot.
Description: A special reserve for Earl Grey lovers, we infuse our top grades of Yunnan Dianhong black tea with the essential oil pressed from real bergamot citrus fruits grown in Calabria, Italy to yield our Earl Grey Supreme blend. We select only bergamot oil made during the first pressing of the year, around November-December, which has the most fragrant perfume and floral aromatic complexity.
Ingredients: Organic black tea, essential bergamot oil
Name: Earl Grey Supreme

Flavor: Exotic black tea with a lush aromatic bouquet of wild rose and lychee
Description:
Origin: Wa Shan, Cangyuan County, Yunnan Province, China
Cultivar:  金萱 Jin Xuan ""Golden Lily""
Elevation: 1,850m
Harvest Date: March 27- April 11th, 2021

Yunnan Lily Black highlights the unforgettable aromas of the Jin Xuan ""Golden Lily"" tea plant cultivar. Jin Xuan was originally developed in Taiwan, where it is processed into a greenish-golden ball-rolled oolong that is often marketed as “Milk Oolong” for its subtly sweet, milky aroma. The Jin Xuan cultivar yields spectacular aromas of East Asian wild rose and lychee fruit when processed into black tea. Yunnan Lily Black is grown in a biodiverse and exceptionally well-managed organic tea garden in Wa Shan, a lush mountainous region of southwestern Yunnan named after the Wa ethnic minority group who calls it home. Yunnan Lily Black is an excellent tea for brewing in the Gongfu Cha style, using a Gaiwan to capture and savor the persistent, lingering rosy aroma that this tea has to offer.
Ingredients: Organic black tea
Name: Yunnan Lily Black
Origin: Wa Shan, Cangyuan county, Yunnan province, China

Flavor: A robust, full-bodied black  tea blended with aromatic  traditional Indian masala spices
Description:
Literally ""mixed spiced tea,"" Masala Chai is a classic style of black tea blended with traditional spices native to South and Southeast Asia. The tea base consists of a robust and malty Assam balanced with our new, lively Orange Pekoe from northern Thailand. Our recipe is unapologetically spicy yet balanced, highlighting aromatic Guatemalan cardamom, hot and citrusy ginger and sweet cinnamon, with accents of pungent cracked black pepper and fragrant cloves. Designed to be brewed both straight up and via stovetop simmered the traditional way in water and milk often with a touch of sweetness.

On the go? Check out our Masala Chai Tea Bags.
Ingredients: organic black tea, organic cinnamon, organic cardamom, organic ginger root, organic black pepper, organic clove
Name: Masala Chai

Description:
Origin: Chamong Garden, Darjeeling, India
Cultivar: Ambari Vegetative 2 & China variety
Elevation: 1372m
Harvest: June 6, 2021

Set high in the Himalayas, Darjeeling is cherished by connoisseurs for yielding teas of extraordinary aromatic depth. Many of the gardens from which we source our teas were founded in the 19th century. While cultivar selection is a factor, the real complexity of Darjeeling teas is to be explored in the diversity of terrain in the gardens. The range in elevation, the pitch of the slope and the amount of sun exposure lead to distinctive differences in character. Each garden has a signature aroma profile. While the first flush produces greenish-golden teas with a tight structure and floral bouquet, the second flush is treasured for more ripened notes of fruits and features a lovely orange-red infusion. The dried leaves feature both chunky tips and buds. In this lot from the Chamong Garden in the Rungbong Valley, we taste luscious peach and floral notes.
Ingredients: Organic black tea
Name: Darjeeling Second Flush Chamong DJ70

Description:
Origin: Lingia Garden, Darjeeling, India
Cultivar: Original China Bush
Elevation: 1,250m
Harvest: March 24, 2021

Set high in the Himalayas, Darjeeling is cherished by connoisseurs for yielding teas of extraordinary aromatic depth. The Lingia garden is planted with pure China leaf of the Black China variety which is genetically closest to the rose bush. While cultivar selection is a factor, the real complexity of Darjeeling teas is to be explored in the diversity of terrain in the gardens. The weather created by this expansive mountain range creates varying microclimates and each garden has a signature aroma profile. The Lingia garden is well-known for its floral notes. The eagerly anticipated First Flush harvest in March-April produces teas with a brilliant golden infusion that captures the essence of spring. This lot from the Lingia garden is sublime with hints of orchid, lilac and Concord grape.
Ingredients: Organic black tea
Name: Darjeeling First Flush Lingia EX2

Flavor: Tuberose, champagne grapes, slight Muscatel, orchid and jasmine with fruity confection notes and good tannin to balance
Description:
Origin: Marybong Garden, Darjeeling, India
Cultivar: Original China Bush
Elevation: 1,450m
Harvest: March 24, 2021

Set high in the Himalayas, Darjeeling is cherished by connoisseurs for yielding teas of extraordinary aromatic depth. The Marybong Garden is over 130 years old, situated in a misty valley with sublime views of the looming, snowcapped Himalayas. The range in elevation, the pitch of the slope and the amount of sun exposure leads to distinctive aroma and flavor characteristics in the tea bushes. The eagerly anticipated First Flush harvest in March-April produces teas with a brilliant golden infusion that captures the essence of spring. In this lot from the Marybong Garden in the Golden Valley, we taste tuberose, champagne grapes, slight Muscatel, orchid and jasmine with fruity confection notes and good tannin to balance.
Ingredients: Organic black tea
Name: Darjeeling First Flush Marybong DJ7

Description: null
Ingredients: null
Name: Gaba Hong Cha, Bulk-GD21

Flavor: Decadent cacao and creamy sarsaparilla with rich coconut and bittersweet dandelion root.
Description: An enticing, chocolatey blend combining strong black tea, dark cocoa shells and nibs with creamy coconut and sarsaparilla for a rich, decadent cup. Designed to be infused straight like tea, or add milk and brew like traditional chai.
Ingredients: Organic black tea, organic coconut flakes, organic cinnamon, organic cocoa shells, organic sarsaparilla root, organic licorice root, organic cocoa nibs, organic roasted dandelion root, organic cloves, natural chocolate flavor
Name: Chocolate Chai

Flavor: Exotic tulsi and cardamom create mystical high notes that perfectly complement grounding black tea and sarsaparilla.
Description:
Tulsi, also known as the ""Queen of Herbs,"" is renowned for its calming effect, offering cognitive and memory enhancement. A great pairing with cardamom, or as it is similarly nicknamed, ""Queen of Spices,"" is prized for many applications including anti-inflammatory properties. Along with invigorating cinnamon, spiced sarsaparilla, sweet licorice root, uplifting peppermint and brisk Darjeeling, Tulsi Chai is a potent blend perfect for chai season with a special herbal twist.

Learn more about Tulsi - The Queen of Herbs.
Ingredients: Organic black tea, organic cinnamon, organic sarsaparilla root, organic cardamom, organic tulsi, organic licorice root, organic peppermint.
Name: Tulsi Chai

Flavor: sweet, earthy, pungent camphor notes with a smooth mouthfeel
Description: Licorice root is typically produced in the Middle East where it originates, Southern Europe, parts of Asia, and even western regions of Northeast China. Used as a pairing herb in Traditional Chinese Medicine, licorice root, or Gan cao 甘草, is considered to be neutral in nature and is used in almost two-thirds of classical formulas in herb blending. The component of licorice root that seems to be the active healer is known as glycyrrhizic acid which gives licorice root its sweet taste.
Ingredients: Organic licorice root
Name: Licorice Root

Flavor: Abounding fresh spring energy with notes of steamed edamame, sugar snap peas, and lightly toasted walnuts.
Description:
Blue Butterfly Pea flowers are native to Thailand, Malaysia and can be found in other parts of SE Asia. The scientific name of the plant is ""Clitoria ternatea"" as the flowers resemble the female genitalia. The flowers have a high content of anthocyanin, a beneficial antioxidant. The flowers have a nootropic effect and may trigger vivid dreams, enhanced memory and brain function. In Thailand, the flowers have been used for centuries for hair and scalp health in ancient types of shampoo.

Nowadays, the flowers are very popular in tea and herbal blends because they easily infuse their vivid blue pigment. The flowers are infused in water, sugar, milk or oil as a natural food color. The blue infusion color can change before your eyes to purple and fuchsia with the addition of lemon, lime or other ingredients that change the pH of the infusion (displayed in the image gallery above). Many new cocktail recipes and cool, color changing herbal teas are being created with this wonderful flower from Thailand.
Ingredients: Butterfly Pea Flower
Name: Butterfly Pea Flower

Description:
Chamomile blossoms have a lovely sweet flavor evoking fruit nectar, apple and quince. Known to botanists as Matricaria recutita, Chamomile has been cultivated and used around the Mediterranean for centuries as a calming herb tea. We select the peak quality blossoms from the most pristine growing regions in Eastern Europe. Chamomile grown here is prized for its purer and brighter taste compared to the common Egyptian type.

These biodegradable, extra-large pyramid sachets hold 2.5g of Chamomile and come in a 35-count bulk bag without individual wrappers.
Ingredients: null
Name: Chamomile

Description: Shiso, also known as Japanese mint, wild sesame or Perilla, is a primary culinary herb of Asia. Scientists have studied shiso tea’s ability to restore health with its high antioxidant value and aromatic compounds. Red shiso contains anthocyanins slightly different from its green shiso counterpart, with a slightly spicier flavor and a basil-like quality. Used frequently in pickling applications, it’s also added for a pop of color. Red shiso provides unique antioxidants, aromas and an enticing infusion hue to infusions and blends.
Ingredients: Organic red shiso
Name: Red Shiso

Flavor: Our prized organic ginger is sourced from Mizoram in northeast India and is heralded for its multidimensional flavor profile brimming with bright and zesty lemony aromas and enlivening, pungent heat.
Description:
Our prized organic ginger is sourced from Mizoram in northeast India and is heralded for its multidimensional flavor profile and warming influence on the body. Ginger is one of the principal ingredients in the traditional herbal medicines and food cultures of Asia. Expect a cup filled with bright and zesty lemony aromas and enlivening, pungent heat.

These biodegradable, extra-large pyramid sachets hold 5.5g of Ginger and come in a 35-count bulk bag without individual wrappers.
Ingredients: Organic ginger root
Name: Ginger

Flavor: Refreshingly tart and fruity with a uniquely quenching balance of five flavors: sweet, sour, salty, bitter, pungent.
Description: The Schisandra (also know as Omija) berry is native to northeastern China, Korea and parts of Siberia. It has been cultivated for thousands of years as a special beautifying tonic herb found in numerous traditional culinary and medicinal recipes. Schisandra is celebrated in China and Korea as an adaptogen—herbs that alleviate stress and help the body deal with physical and mental fatigue. The adaptogenic properties of schisandra have been cited for centuries in Asian tradition for helping beautify and protect the skin from environmental stress. It is also said that schisandra's concentrated B-vitamin complex and antioxidant activity help support healthy liver function and hormonal balance. Schisandra is harvested in late summer and can be pressed fresh into juice or sun-dried for use in a variety of preparations such as herbal teas, vitality tonics and infused liquors. Schisandra literally means ""five-flavor berry,"" alluding to its uniquely complex flavor profile with sweet, sour, salty, bitter and pungent aspects found in different parts of the berry.
Ingredients: Organic schisandra berries
Name: Schisandra Berries

Flavor: Enlivening heat with a bright, spicy lemony aroma
Description: Ginger is one of the principal ingredients in the traditional herbal medicines and food cultures of Asia. Each year we taste ginger from a range of origins to select only the most zesty and energizing. We seek a specific balance of enlivening, pungent spicy heat with a bright, lemony aroma.
Ingredients: Organic ginger root
Name: Ginger

Flavor: ume wine, wild oregano and tarragon
Description: Shiso, also known as Japanese mint, wild sesame or Perilla, is a key culinary herb of Asia. Scientists have studied shiso tea’s ability to restore health with its high antioxidant value and aromatic compounds. Other notable uses include cold and flu prevention, skincare, anti-aging, respiratory support and digestion. Green shiso lends an almost tea-like quality to infusions, especially when blended with citrus peels or other brightly acidic ingredients.
Ingredients: Organic green shiso
Name: Green Shiso

Flavor: aromas of spring meadows, elegant green teas and a unique herbal sweetness
Description:
Artemisia is an herb that has had many names over thousands of years of use, including Qinghai 青蒿, sweet wormwood and Artemisia annua. Culturally rooted in Traditional Chinese Medicine, artemisia was first notated in The Divine Farmer’s Materia Medica. This plant has a tannin structure, notable polyphenols and aromatic compounds like green tea, but is caffeine-free with detoxifying properties. The plant is high in antioxidants and is considered to have a warming effect, while green tea is known for its cooling effects.

Many of the same antioxidants and aromatic compounds in artemisia are also contained in lemongrass, verbena, wintergreen, and other types of herbs. The components coumarin and quinine are also found in the plant, which are a key ingredient in tonic water and tea cocktails.
Ingredients: Organic Artemisia annua
Name: Artemisia

Flavor: Naturally sweet and refreshing  pure African rooibos with a  deep red, nectar-like infusion
Description: null
Ingredients: Organic rooibos
Name: Rooibos

Flavor: Bittersweet, toasty herby flavor with nuances of olive leaf and eucalyptus
Description:
Yerba Mate is an uplifting and energizing herb that is indigenous to the Amazon and is wildly popular throughout parts of South America for its robust flavor. Often thought of as the ""tea"" of Latin America, yerba mate is one of just four botanicals in the Americas to contain caffeine. It has a bittersweet, earthy and mineral flavor with nuances of olive leaf and eucalyptus. Traditional roasting and aging of yerba mate creates a pleasant, toasted aroma and ranging complexity.

Learn more about Yerba Mate on our Journal
Ingredients: Organic yerba mate
Name: Yerba Mate

Flavor: floral and spicy aromatic complexity, refreshing and calming adaptogenic function
Description: Tulsi, or Holy Basil, is one of the cornerstone adaptogens of Ayurvedic herbology. Tulsi is renowned for its calming effect, known to offer cognitive and memory-enhancing properties as well as being anti-inflammatory and immune-boosting. There are quite a few types of cultivars referred to as Holy Basil, and this particular variety is sometimes referred to as “Spice Basil” with its unique, spicy aroma. Kapoor Tulsi plants have purple flowers, in contrast to varying colored blooms on other types of Holy Basil. This type of tulsi is frequently applied as a healthful vitality tonic in herbal medicinal practices.
Ingredients: Organic Kapoor tulsi
Name: Kapoor Tulsi

Flavor: Golden liquoring infusion with a fragrance reminiscent of honey and fruit blossoms
Description: Chamomile blossoms have a lovely sweet flavor evoking fruit nectar, apple and quince. Known to botanists as German Chamomile, Matricaria recutita has been cultivated and used around the Mediterranean for centuries. We select the peak quality blossoms from the most pristine chamomile growing regions in Eastern Europe.
Ingredients: Organic chamomile flowers
Name: Golden Chamomile Blossoms

Description: Unlike ornamental hibiscus flowers, it is the calyx of the shrubby Hibiscus sabdariffa plant that is used for making a tangy-sweet herbal tea that is equally delicious brewed hot or iced. Harvested by hand when plump and juicy, hibiscus makes a full-bodied, crimson colored infusion with a flavor similar to tart cranberry. Hibiscus is used in culinary and drinks recipes by cultures spanning equatorial latitudes from Southeast Asia to the Caribbean.
Ingredients: Organic hibiscus flowers
Name: Hibiscus

Flavor: Distinctive flavor and heady aroma, calms the body and soothes the digestive system
Description:
Our pure peppermint leaves hail from the Pacific Northwest, where certain cultivars are prized as some of the most aromatic and potent in the world. We seek a specific strain of Mentha x piperita that offers a bright candy cane flavor.

On the go? Check out our Pacific Peppermint Tea Bags.
Ingredients: Organic peppermint
Name: Peppermint

Flavor: Decadent vanilla bean and sweet Saigon Cinnamon complement smooth, rich pu'er tea
Description: Luxuriously textured and inviting, Vanilla Mint Chai combines the sweetest grade of Saigon cinnamon, rich cocoa and aromatic peppermint with bold Pu'er tea. Accents of silken vanilla bean transforms this chai into a sublime, heady cup.
Ingredients: Organic Pu'er tea, organic cocoa shells, organic cinnamon, organic peppermint, organic vanilla bean, organic licorice root
Name: Vanilla Mint Chai

Flavor: An exquisite blend of revitalizing and pungent turmeric balanced with classic chai spices and enriched with roasted coconut, sumptuous vanilla bean, and creamy sarsaparilla root.
Description: This exquisite caffeine-free chai highlights the lovely golden color and revitalizing pungency of turmeric in a seductive blend of roasted coconut, sumptuous vanilla bean and creamy sarsaparilla root. Classic chai notes of exotic cardamom, zesty ginger and spicy black pepper create irresistible depth. Turmeric Chai can be brewed like tea or used as a foundation for inventive chai recipes with nut milks, black tea or even rosewater.
Ingredients: Organic coconut, organic turmeric, organic ginger root, organic cardamom, organic cinnamon, organic sarsaparilla root, organic vanilla bean, organic black pepper, natural lychee flavor, natural rose extract
Name: Turmeric Chai

Flavor: A robust, full-bodied black  tea blended with aromatic  traditional Indian masala spices
Description:
Literally ""mixed spiced tea,"" Masala Chai is a classic style of black tea blended with traditional spices native to South and Southeast Asia. The tea base consists of a robust and malty Assam balanced with our new, lively Orange Pekoe from northern Thailand. Our recipe is unapologetically spicy yet balanced, highlighting aromatic Guatemalan cardamom, hot and citrusy ginger and sweet cinnamon, with accents of pungent cracked black pepper and fragrant cloves. Designed to be brewed both straight up and via stovetop simmered the traditional way in water and milk often with a touch of sweetness.

On the go? Check out our Masala Chai Tea Bags.
Ingredients: organic black tea, organic cinnamon, organic cardamom, organic ginger root, organic black pepper, organic clove
Name: Masala Chai

Flavor: Exotic tulsi and cardamom create mystical high notes that perfectly complement grounding black tea and sarsaparilla.
Description:
Tulsi, also known as the ""Queen of Herbs,"" is renowned for its calming effect, offering cognitive and memory enhancement. A great pairing with cardamom, or as it is similarly nicknamed, ""Queen of Spices,"" is prized for many applications including anti-inflammatory properties. Along with invigorating cinnamon, spiced sarsaparilla, sweet licorice root, uplifting peppermint and brisk Darjeeling, Tulsi Chai is a potent blend perfect for chai season with a special herbal twist.

Learn more about Tulsi - The Queen of Herbs.
Ingredients: Organic black tea, organic cinnamon, organic sarsaparilla root, organic cardamom, organic tulsi, organic licorice root, organic peppermint.
Name: Tulsi Chai

Flavor: Decadent cacao and creamy sarsaparilla with rich coconut and bittersweet dandelion root.
Description: An enticing, chocolatey blend combining strong black tea, dark cocoa shells and nibs with creamy coconut and sarsaparilla for a rich, decadent cup. Designed to be infused straight like tea, or add milk and brew like traditional chai.
Ingredients: Organic black tea, organic coconut flakes, organic cinnamon, organic cocoa shells, organic sarsaparilla root, organic licorice root, organic cocoa nibs, organic roasted dandelion root, organic cloves, natural chocolate flavor
Name: Chocolate Chai

Flavor: Sweet, soothing West Cape  rooibos balanced by exotic  masala spices
Description: Rich red rooibos, along with sweet cinnamon and aromatic cardamom, impart a familiar taste to this caffeine free chai blend. Enlivening star anise mixes with assertive ginger, floral and pungent black pepper and the roasted coffee-like character of ramón nut to produce a truly original anytime chai. With its dark red infusion, West Cape Chai is the perfect base for lattes and innovative café drinks.
Ingredients: Organic rooibos, organic cinnamon, organic ginger root, organic cardamom, organic ramon nut, organic star anise, organic licorice root, organic fennel seed, organic black pepper, organic cloves, organic peppermint
Name: West Cape Chai

Description: Do you love your chai hot and extra spicy? Spicy Masala Chai is designed for you. We added cayenne chili flakes in addition to a double concentration of ginger to deliver a thoroughly warming chai experience. Classic aromatic accents of cloves, cinnamon and cardamom add rich depth.
Ingredients: organic cardamom, organic ginger root, organic cinnamon, organic black tea, organic black pepper, organic cloves, organic chili flakes, essential ginger oil
Name: Spicy Masala Chai

Flavor: Rich and sweet umami with floral Sakura and alpine herbal notes
Description:
Origin: Nishi-san’s garden, Kirishima Mountain, Kagoshima Prefecture, Japan 
Cultivar: Okumidori
Harvest: May 11, 2021
Elevation: 330m

Gyokuro is the most prestigious and rare shade-grown green tea from Japan. Nishi San’s teas are celebrated throughout Japan. Not only is the Nishi family renowned for being pioneers of organic tea cultivation in Japan, but they are also recognized for their masterful soil management and dedication to developing many types of teas with their wide range of organically grown tea cultivars. This organic gyokuro is crafted from the Okumidori cultivar which showcases Nishi San’s rustic style and the volcanic soil mountain terroir of Kirishima. We are proud to partner with Nishi San to provide a rare opportunity to source organic, premium grade gyokuro made according to his unqiue organic methods.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Nishi San’s Organic Okumidori Gyokuro
Origin: Nishi-san's Garden, Kirishima Mountain, Kagoshima Prefecture, Japan

Flavor: aromas of spring meadows, chrysanthemums, elegant green teas, tart citrus and a unique herbal sweetness
Description:
Artemisia is an herb with an ancient history taken as a remedy for coughs, colds and influenza. Its natural extracts are employed as an antiviral in modern medicines and antimalarial drugs. It is used by herbalists in teas and tinctures to unblock pent up Qi (life energy)and to disperse inner heat caused by intermittent fatigue or illness. Artemisia annua is commonly known as ""sweet wormwood"" and has a special tannin structure similar to green tea and tonic water with notable polyphenols and aromatic compounds that pair well with the green tea and enlivening botanicals of this blend. Artemisia Qi Tonic is caffeinated and energized by Tencha, the stimulating and refreshing Japanese shade-grown tea used to make Matcha. The blend of artemisia and green tea is balanced with aromatic California lemon zest and anti-oxidant rich shiso leaves to create a bitter-sweet, wonderfully fragrant and stimulating infusion to expel dreary winter fatigue.

Learn more about the benefits and history of Artemisia.
Ingredients: organic lemon, organic green tea, organic green shiso, organic Artemisia annua
Name: Artemisia Qi Tonic

Flavor: complex tannin structure, tuberose and jasmine with a heady citrus scent, rich aftertaste and strong energy
Description:
Origin: Ha Giang Province Province, Vietnam 
Cultivar: Localized Shan Thuyet variety  
Harvest: Spring 2020 Scented February 2021 
Elevation: 1200m  

Pomelo citrus blossom scented green tea is a marvelous experience for traditional flower-scented tea enthusiasts. Pomelo citrus trees have elegant and deeply fragrant blossoms that bloom before bearing delicious grapefruit-like fruits. The flowers are used to scent tea in the similar fashion as jasmine blossoms or roses are used traditionally scent green tea. 
  
High mountain, first flush green tea from Northern Vietnam is scented with the fresh blossoms of pomelo and aged with a small content of the dried pomelo tree flowers.
Ingredients: Scented green tea
Name: Pomelo Blossom Green Tea

Description:
Origin: Vi Xuyen, Ha Giang Province, Northern Vietnam
Cultivar: Ha Giang Ancient Trees
Harvest: 2021
Elevation: 1400m

This early spring, high mountain micro-lot is from ancient tea trees harvested by the Dao Ethnic people located in Vi Xuyen, Ha Giang in Northern Vietnam. Shan Tuyết translates as “Snow Mountain” and references the clouds and cold foggy mists where these old trees grow. The tea leaves are coated in snow white silvery down, and the trees themselves are large and gnarled, covered in misty dew, lichen, moss and wild orchids. The trees have a unique look and patina with their frosted, snow white flora.

The ancient trees of Ha Giang Province are highly revered in Vietnam and China for the complexity of the tannin structure and the overall taste of tea these trees produce. The young, downy leaves are processed using a “green snow needle” technique, creating a pure bud with a frosted appearance. Snow Shan is produced in many provinces, but Ha Giang is the premier origin. Don’t let the delicate nature of the tea fool you—the tea has a potent taste, vibrant energy and a remarkable and lasting presence.
Ingredients: Green tea
Name: Shan Tuyet Green Tea
Origin: Vi Xuyen, Ha Giang Province, Northern Vietnam

Flavor: remarkably fresh-savory flavor profile that produces a slightly salty umami balanced with a pleasant, sweet grassiness
Description:
Origin: Nishi-san’s garden, Kirishima Mountain, Kagoshima Prefecture, Japan
Cultivar: Saemidori
Elevation: 300m
Harvest: April 10, 2021

Each year the Nishi family produces a special batch of hand-picked Shincha to celebrate the old-school artisan technique of harvesting by hand. Shincha literally means “new tea” and is representative of the first plucks of the tea harvest. Each region in Japan sees a slightly different first harvest due to the great variance in terrain and the effects of elevation. This year on Kagoshima Mountain they picked exclusively from Saemidori plants to make this single-cultivar Shincha. It comes as no surprise that Saemidori translates to “bright green” when observing the brilliant hue of its infusion. This Shincha produces a vivid, very bright green liquor and has a remarkably fresh-savory flavor profile that produces a slightly salty umami balanced with a pleasant, sweet grassiness. Renowned throughout Japan as pioneers of organic tea cultivation, the Nishi family has captured the vibrancy of spring in this remarkable hand-picked single-cultivar gem.
Ingredients: null
Name: Nishi-san’s Shincha Single Cultivar Saemidori
Origin: Nishi-san's Garden, Kirishima Mountain, Kagoshima Prefecture, Japan

Flavor: An enlivening and refreshing green  tea with a rich savory-sweet  flavor and creamy mouthfeel
Description: Kukicha is a traditional green tea unique to Japan. It is created by blending tender leaves, stems and stem fibers called keba that are collected during sencha processing. Kukicha is a perfect example of the Japanese way of making tea, in which no part of the harvest is wasted. Our Kukicha is pleasantly sweet with a lovely greenish gold infusion and creamy mouthfeel. Asamushi sencha provides delicate fresh notes while lightly roasted stems provide balancing sweetness, and tender keba leaf fibers create a full, enriching body. Kukicha is a wonderfully bright green tea that is surprising sweet and ideal for those sensitive to astringency.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Kukicha

Flavor: Evergreen, Orchid, Li Shan Oolong, toasted gingko nut, sugar cookie
Description:
Origin: Tenryu Ward, Shizuoka , Japan
Cultivar: Koushun
Elevation: 350 m
Harvest Date: May 12, 2021

This tea is from the remote, high mountain and deep forest tea gardens of the eastern region of Tenryu Ward in Shizuoka, Japan. Tenryu high mountain valley tea gardens have a much later first flush harvest schedule due to the limited days of sunshine and dramatic differences between daytime and nighttime temperatures. We selected a specialized Shizuoka cross-breed cultivar named Koushun from the Mother of Kurosawa and the Father of Kanayamidori tea bushes. Koushun is favored for specialized oxidized teas and kamairicha (pan-fired, farmer’s sickle shaped tea). This micro-lot of Tenryu grown Koushun was processed in this kamairi style with applied and innovative special withering to evoke a character of high mountain oolong tea with a balance of umami, gentle roast and complex florals.
Ingredients: Organic Green Tea
Name: Tenryu  Single Cultivar Koushun

Flavor: Unique Yunnan genetics and these intricate processing steps yield complex tasting notes of orchid, zesty parsnip, hemlock bark and melon skin.
Description:
Origin: Jinggu, Yunnan, China
Cultivar: Jinggu Da Bai, Da Huang Ya, & Changye Bai Hao
Elevation: 1,200m
Harvest: May 7-10 2021

Silver Spear, or  Yin Qiang 银枪 in Chinese, originates from a specialty cultivar garden in Jinggu, just outside of Pu’er City. We worked with Ms. Yang and members of the Wa ethnic group to harvest this tea in the early spring high mountain season. It is a blend of three cultivars, Jinggu Da Bai, Changye Bai Hao and Da Huang Ya used for the notable large, silvery buds. The particular leaf shaking tables and drying technique render the interesting needle shape of this tea which resembles the form of an ancient Chinese silver spearhead. Unique Yunnan genetics and these intricate processing steps yield complex tasting notes and a really special tea.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Silver Spear

Flavor: rich umami dashi broth, oyster mushroom, tangy and sweet kombu with fruity and flowery notes
Description:
Origin: Uji, Japan
Cultivar: Gokou, Hoshun, Samidori, Yabukita
Harvest: Month of May in 2009, 2020, 2021, and June of 2020  
Elevation:  20-150m

Gyokuro, literally “jade dew,” is the most prestigious and rare shade-grown green tea from Japan. This year we selected two gyokuro teas from the esteemed Uji region of Japan. Uji teas tend to emphasize richness of umami taste with savory and sweet flavors akin to kombu, snap pea, broth and mushroom-dashi. Shupin translates as “competition grade.” This top-shelf Uji Gyokuro comes from one of our farm partners in Uji, a 5th generation Gyokuro and matcha tea producing family. This family creates vintage blends for a gyokuro tea contest held annually in Kyoto. Vintage blends are released each year at the outset of Autumn. This 2021 edition has zero astringency and a seriously high level of umami and sweetness. The richness of the infusion is amazing and almost gelatinous, like an emerald green dashi broth with sweet and tangy kombu and fruity, flowery notes of oyster mushroom.
Ingredients: Green tea
Name: Uji Shupin Gyokuro

Flavor: deep umami and creamy sweetness balanced with fresh hints of snap pea. The bright emerald green infusion is lively and full of spring energy
Description:
Origin: Nishi-san’s garden, Kirishima Mountain, Kagoshima Prefecture, Japan
Cultivar: Asatsuyu
Elevation: 250m
Harvest: April 22, 2021

The Nishi Family is renowned throughout Japan as pioneers of organic tea cultivation. This year, they selected several specialized lots for us, including this micro-lot of shincha crafted from the Asatsuyu cultivar. Asatsuyu means “morning dew” and is an original cultivar developed in the modern Japanese agriculture breeding programs from the 1950’s. Harvested in the early spring season, it matures to flush just after Saemidori and before Yabukita.

Picked at its peak quality with deep milky sweetness, rich umami and freshness, the timing of the harvest yielded such a low fiber content, when infused, the leaves turn into an emerald jelly-like substance, akin to what one may expect from brewed gyokuro leaves. Kabuse shading enhances its deep green color and creamy sweetness.

This shincha is a vivid green example of chumushi (mid-steamed) process, which creates a smaller leaf particle size that in turn results in a full-bodied and opaque emerald cup. It is invigorating with deep umami and creamy sweetness balanced with fresh hints of snap pea. The bright emerald green infusion is lively and full of spring energy.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Nishi-san’s Single Cultivar Asatsuyu Shincha
Origin: Nishi-san's Garden, Kirishima Mountain, Kagoshima Prefecture, Japan

Flavor: Unctuous aroma with silken, creamy mouthfeel and savory umami reminiscent of uni.
Description:
Rishi is lucky enough to be one of the few to whom Tsuji-san sells his matcha, which has been analyzed to have the highest amino acids scores and L-theanine content of any matcha in Japan and the world. Each cultivar gives us specific tasting notes. In Tsuji-san's Matcha Samidori, we experience an unctuous aroma with silken, creamy mouthfeel and savory umami reminiscent of uni. Tea bushes for premium matcha are harvested once per year. The farming technique is unique as it utilizes shading, and this focuses the plant's energy on the top, tender leaves. The intense shading forces the bushes to make their leaves fatter and greener, with increased chlorophyll to seek out the sun. In turn, this farming practice greatly enhances the nootropic and neuro-stimulating substances.

Origin: Uji-Shirakawa, Kyoto, Japan
Cultivar: Samidori
Elevation: 250m
Harvest: May 2018

Makers Spotlight: Tsuji-san's Matcha
Ingredients: Japanese green tea.
Name: Tsuji-san's Matcha Samidori

Flavor: pleasant pine and savory herbaceous notes balanced with the sweet nuttiness of roasted chestnuts
Description:
Cultivar: Long Jing #43
Elevation: 750 - 800m
Origin: Jin Long Ping Village, Xuan’En County, Hubei Province, China
