Harvest: March 8-14 2021

This Dragon Well is comprised of tender buds and leaves harvested during the early spring Mingqian time, making for a rich, brothy and sweet infusion. Dragon Well is a well-known, Chinese “tribute tea” once given in tribute to the emperor of the time. Made from the traditional cultivar called Long Jing #43 (literally, “Dragon Well #43”), this micro-lot offers the classic Dragon Well character of pleasant pine and savory herbaceous notes balanced with the sweet nuttiness of roasted chestnuts.
 
Dragon Well is a pan-fired green tea that is produced by “flat-frying” tea leaves in a hot pan until shaped into blades and dried. The heat and tossing action carried out in pan-firing tea leaves initiates the Maillard reaction, resulting in a pleasant toasty aroma and nutty sweetness.
Ingredients: Organic Green Tea
Name: Dragon Well Single Cultivar Long Jing #43
Origin: Jin Long Ping Village, Xuan'En County, Hubei Province, China
Link: Dragon Well Single Cultivar Long Jing #43

Flavor: Premium Japanese green tea with a rich mouthfeel and long-lasting fresh flavor
Description: Sencha is the traditional, daily steamed green tea of Japan. Our Sencha is made from prized tea bush cultivars including Saemidori and Okumidori, and is a blend of the first and second flush harvests from organic farms on Kyushu island in southern Japan. Kyushu's mineral rich volcanic soil, coupled with skillful organic soil management, creates a sweet and full-bodied green tea flavor. This chumushi sencha yields a slightly opaque, bold green infusion with deep umami and juicy mouthfeel.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Sencha

Flavor: Delicate savoriness, a sweetness reminiscent of corn silk and is balanced with medium tannins.
Description:
Origin: Jinggu county, Yunnan province, China
Cultivar: Jinggu Da Bai
Elevation: 1,200 m
Harvest: May 7-10 2021

Snow Buds, or 雪芽 Xue Ya in Chinese, is a unique and more recent style of green tea which typically uses a white tea cultivar and employs a process that is a combination of white and Chinese green tea, revealing delicate floral nuance. Many Chinese green teas use pan-frying alone to halt the oxidation process, which imparts more flavor into the finished product of the tea.  The process used for this Xue Ya combines tumble drum roasting and oven drying to coax out sweetness and concentrated umami. The dual process allows the subtle florality to take center stage and creates a tea with fewer vegetal notes.  The Jinggu Da Bai, or literally “Big White,” with Jinggu being an autonomous county in Yunnan, is renowned for its downy, fuzz and delicate flavor. The trichomes are left intact on this tea, so take note of the silver down present on the leaf.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Yunnan Snow Buds

Flavor: Premium organic peppermint blended with floral-scented green tea
Description: Moroccan Mint is a traditional green tea enjoyed throughout the world, balancing the bright taste of peppermint with lively green tea that can be sweetened to taste. Our version features jasmine green tea for an aromatic complexity not found in common Moroccan Mint teas.
Ingredients: Organic green tea with jasmine, organic peppermint
Name: Moroccan Mint

Flavor: tender dewy sweetness that is pleasantly herbaceous and umami
Description:
Origin: Jin Long Ping Village, Xuan’En County, Hubei Province, China
Cultivar: Long Jing #43
Elevation: 750 - 800m
Harvest: March 15th, 2021

This early spring tea is brimming with nutrients, offering a rich savory-sweetness and vibrancy on found in the first of the first flush harvests. This micro-lot was produced using the Long Jing #43 cultivar, which offers a balance of tender dewy sweetness that is pleasantly herbaceous and umami.

Green Needles (Lu Zhen) is a traditional pine needle-shaped green tea from Hubei province. After withering, the tea leaves are fired in a small tumble-roasters, then shaped using special heated table machines that shake the tea leaves back-and-forth repeatedly to coax the leaves into straight needles. The tea leaves are initially dried on hot air-flow tables while stirred and then finally baked to perfection in an oven. Infuse with care not to over-steep in order to savor the rich complexity of this early spring tea.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Green Needles Single Cultivar Long Jing #43
Origin: Jin Long Ping Village, Xuan'En County, Hubei Province, China
Link: Green Needles Single Cultivar Long Jing #43

Flavor: Mellow with a sweet mint flavor,  a pleasant toasty note and  hints of chocolate
Description: The fresh, sweet flavor and long-lasting candy cane mint aroma of peppermint from the Pacific Northwest blends smoothly with the pleasant character of roasted green tea. This blend evokes mint chocolate in a clean, gratifying way. Green Tea Mint makes a wonderful cup to enjoy after a meal.
Ingredients: Organic green tea, organic peppermint
Name: Green Tea Mint

Flavor: The depth of umami and sweetness is finely balanced with this slight hika and freshness
Description:
Origin: Uji, Japan
Cultivar: Gokou, Hoshun, Samidori, Yabukita
Harvest: Month of May in vintages 2008, 2009, 2020, 2021
Elevation:  20-120m

Gyokuro, literally “jade dew,” is the most prestigious and rare shade-grown green tea from Japan. This year we selected two gyokuro teas from the esteemed Uji region of Japan. Uji teas tend to emphasize richness of umami taste with savory and sweet flavors akin to kombu, snap pea and mushroom-dashi. Prime gyokuro from Uji is typically a variety of vintages blended by seasoned tea masters to achieve an outstanding profile specific to Uji terroir and style. The Homare grade contains vintage ranges from 2008-2021 blended to highlight the classic, deep and mellow taste of Uji tea. Vintage blends are released each year at the outset of Autumn. This is a high end tea but our entry point to Uji Gyokuro. The Homare blend has no astringency, a rich umami and sweetness with a fresh glow with some very subtle hika that harmonizes all the elements of the tea.
Ingredients: Green tea
Name: Uji Homare Gyokuro

Flavor: Deep umami and rich flavor with notes of sweet hijiki preserve and slight salinity
Description:
Origin: Okabe, Shizuoka Prefecture, Japan
Cultivar: Saemidori, Gokou, Okumidori and Yabukita
Harvest: May 11, 12, 17, 20 & 21 2021
Elevation: 110m

Gyokuro, literally “jade dew,” is the most prestigious and rare shade-grown green tea from Japan is the most prestigious and rare shade-grown green tea from Japan. This year we selected gyokuro from three producers in the Okabe region: Tohei San, Maejima San and Omura San Each teamaker offers an expression of the classic Okabe style, which emphasizes a unique mountain freshness balanced with umami depth. Tohei San cultivates gyokuro according to the traditional tana method of shading tea bushes with woven straw-thatch mats called komo, which he weaves himself. It is more time-consuming than modern methods, but worth the extra effort. This year, Tohei San's Gyokuro has umami and rich flavor with notes of hijiki preserve. The special balance of umami and high mountain minerals taste is refreshing and energizing.
Ingredients: Green tea
Name: Tohei San's Gyokuro

Flavor: roasted barley, toasted almonds, herbaceous spice, warming ginger and uplifting mint
Description: Houjicha Shiso is a warming Japanese green tea perfect for the transition into colder months. A hot roasting step transforms the green tea through the Maillard reaction into light brown leaves that brew an amber-red infusion. The roast step also lowers the caffeine content of the tea leaves, making this tea an ideal after dinner cup. Red shiso has a spicy flavor and purply hue that complements the amber brew of the houjicha. Bamboo ginger, a highly aromatic variety of ginger, provides a warming heat to balance the other herbaceous botanicals. The blend is finished with peppermint leaves which bring an uplifting minty note.
Ingredients: organic green tea, organic red shiso, bamboo ginger, organic peppermint
Name: Houjicha Shiso

Flavor: deep umami and classic kabuse aroma featuring a really special sweetness with notes of hijiki, kombu and mulberry leaves
Description:
Origin: Aobane Factory, Okabe, Shizuoka prefecture, Japan
Cultivar: Yabukita, Meiryoku
Harvest:  May 2, 2021
Elevation: 250 m

The Okabe region of Shizuoka, Japan is famous for its amazing Gyokuro and high-end, wrap-shadedsencha variants known as Kabusecha. The distinguishing characteristics of Kabusecha are rich and smooth taste with low-tannin and a deep, blue-green jade leaf and opaque infusion color. Kabusecha has an unmistakable, sought-after and hard to define savory, sweet and stimulating aromatic profile called kabuse kaori. The natural farming practiced in Okabe focuses on composting and traditional enrichment of the soil to boost amino acid and special flavor. The bushes for this Okabe cultivar blend were shaded for more than 2 weeks prior to harvest in order to elevate chlorophyll levels and amino acid contents much like Gyokuro or Tencha. The result is a tea of sublime balance with deep umami and rich layers of flavor and residual sweetness. Tasting notes of tangy-sweet Hijiiki, Kombu-dashi, wheatgrass juice and marinated Kampyo tree gourd preserves are a rare treat.
Ingredients: Green tea
Name: Okabe Deep Kabuse

Flavor: Full-bodied sweetness, bold mint flavor and zesty notes of cardamom, ginger and spices
Description: Maghreb Mint celebrates the traditional mint teas and culinary spices of North Africa with a wondrous balance of roasted green tea, sweet peppermint, zesty ginger and lively cardamom. Hints of fennel and clove provide exotic aromatic accents. Maghreb Mint can be infused straight-up like tea or prepared in the traditional style, simmered in boiling water with a touch of sugar to make a uniquely stimulating chai.
Ingredients: Organic green tea, organic ginger root, organic peppermint, organic cardamom, organic licorice root, organic fennel seed, organic cloves, organic black pepper
Name: Maghreb Mint

Flavor: Top shelf green tea combining first flush matcha with gyokuro for the most vivid emerald green infusion and lush umami flavor.
Description: Inspired by the popularity of our Matcha Super Green tea (first flush matcha blended with first and second flush sencha) we developed a super-premium version with organic gyokuro. Whereas Matcha Super Green highlights the fresh bittersweet character of sencha, Matcha Gyokuro has a smoother profile that delivers a rich concentration of umami and a silky, creamy finish unlike any other green tea we've ever formulated. L-theanine junkies rejoice!
Ingredients: Organic gyokuro, organic matcha
Name: Matcha Gyokuro

Flavor: stimulating with oceanic note, umami and evergreen aroma
Description:
Origin:  Jin Long Ping Village, Xuan’En County, Hubei Province, China
Cultivar: Bendizhong (“Indigenous Group”)
Elevation:  750-800m
Harvest:  March 22nd, 2021

This micro-lot of Green Needles is produced from heirloom tea bushes called “Bendizhong,” an indigenous variety of tea prized in this growing region since the mid-1700’s. The rocky gardens of Xuan’En County offer rich tasting and balanced green teas with high density, bold energy, slight umami and evergreen notes that refresh and invigorate.

Green Needles (Lu Zhen) is a traditional pine needle-shaped green tea from Hubei province. After withering, the tea leaves are fired in a small tumble-roasters, then shaped using special heated table machines that shake the tea leaves back-and-forth repeatedly to coax the leaves into straight needles. The tea leaves are initially dried on hot air-flow tables while stirred and then finally baked to perfection in an oven. Infuse with care not to over-steep in order to savor the rich complexity of this early spring tea.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Green Needles Single Cultivar Bendizhong
Origin: Jin Long Ping Village, Xuan'En County, Hubei Province, China

Flavor: intricate herbaceous and floral aromas with notes of sweet chestnut that harmonize and resonate with the freshness and deep taste of this tea
Description:
Origin: Kagoshima, Japan
Cultivar: Asanoka
Elevation: 200-300m
Harvest: April 14th & 16th, 2021

The Asanoka cultivar is a special hybrid of Yabukita and a China bush variety. It was developed during the 1990s in Kagoshima. Asanoka is regarded for its unique aromatic complexity, density of flavor and rich green infusion.

The umami to bittersweet ratio and the medium steaming level of this batch presents the Kagoshima terroir and single cultivar characteristics really well. The final baking brings forth a satisfying aroma of sweet roasted chestnuts that harmonizes and resonates with the freshness of the tea.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Single Cultivar Asanoka Sencha

Flavor: Oceanic tasting notes balanced with minerality of fleur de sel, rich umami and is reminiscent of exotic mushroom consommé and bonito dashi
Description:
Origin: Okabe, Shizuoka Prefecture, Japan
Cultivar: Saemidori
Harvest: April 27, 2021
Elevation:  90m

Gyokuro, literally “jade dew,” is the most prestigious and rare shade-grown green tea from Japan. This year we selected gyokuro from three producers in the Okabe region: Tohei San, Maejima San and Omura San. Each teamaker offers an expression of the classic Okabe style, which emphasizes a unique mountain freshness balanced with umami depth. Maejima San uses straw thatch to create special shades for his gyokuro, which gives the tea its deep depth, high levels of amino acids and low levels of catechins. This tea has an exquisite leaf shape and appearance with a deep blue-green hue and clear yet flavorful infusion. This year, the tea has a surprising and lively brisk character with richness of umami. It is a very stimulating and full-flavored palate. The mountain terroir of Okabe can be felt in this tea.
Ingredients: Green Tea
Name: Maejima San's Gyokuro

Flavor: dewy, kombu seaweed, Sakura, cacao fruit
Description:
Origin: Kirishima Mountain, Kagoshima, Japan
Cultivar: Asanoka
Elevation: 350m
Harvest: April 14 & 16, 2021

The Asanoka cultivar is a special breed developed during the 1990s in Kagoshima. The cultivar parents are Yabukita and a China bush variety. Asanoka is a newer cultivar and was placed on the Japanese Tea Registry later compared to many of the other enlisted varieties.

Asanoka is noted for its amazing aroma and lively infusion quality that is notably unique from other Kagoshima teas. Asanoka has multifaceted floral notes, very rich umami flavor and a complex tannin structure. Its distinctive and deep tasting profile makes Asanoka a special cultivar for kabuse sencha and tencha for matcha.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Single Cultivar Asanoka Tencha

Flavor: floral, piney and stimulating with sandalwood and fresh sancho pepper aroma
Description:
Origin:  Jin Long Ping Village, Xuan’En County, Hubei Province, China
Cultivar:  E-Cha #1
Elevation: 750 - 800m
Harvest: March 22nd, 2021

This is an amazingly floral, piney and stimulating micro-lot of Green Needles produced from the single-bud plucks of a cultivar localized to Hubei known as E-Cha #1. This cultivar of tea bush has a strong tannin profile with expressive flowery and fresh evergreen aromatics when it is harvested during the early spring. E-Cha #1 cultivar is so strong that we only make “Jade Buds” single-bud pluck style of Green Needles with it during the early spring. As the temperature and humidity rise in the E-Cha #1 gardens after early spring so does the total tannin and polyphenols. The subsequent later Spring and Summer harvests of E-Cha 1 are made into our series of Yi Hong gongfu red tea.

Green Needles (Lu Zhen) is a traditional pine needle-shaped green tea from Hubei province. After withering, the tea leaves are fired in a small tumble-roasters, then shaped using special heated table machines that shake the tea leaves back-and-forth repeatedly to coax the leaves into straight needles. The tea leaves are initially dried on hot air-flow tables while stirred and then finally baked to perfection in an oven. Infuse with care not to over-steep in order to savor the rich complexity of this early spring tea.
Ingredients: null
Name: Green Needles Single Cultivar E-Cha #1
Origin: Jin Long Ping Village, Xuan'En County, Hubei Province, China

Flavor: An energizing blend of matcha and sencha with a deep sweetness and smooth, umami richness
Description:
Our greenest green tea, Matcha Super Green combines first and second flush sencha with bright matcha green tea powder for a supercharged, vivid green cup. Sencha lends delicious umami and sweetness that are enlivened by the fresh points of pure Japanese matcha. Known for its high concentration of L-theanine amino acid, matcha lends this tea an uplifting energy and Zen buzz that goes beyond what is found with a typical sencha. Matcha Super Green yields two brilliant infusions: most of the matcha is released in the first infusion for an ultra-rich cup, followed by a second infusion that presents a welcome sweetness comprised mostly of sencha.

On the go? Check out our Matcha Super Green Tea Bags.
Ingredients: Organic sencha green tea, organic matcha
Name: Matcha Super Green

Flavor: A refreshing everyday green tea with a mild sweet flavor and pleasant roasted aroma
Description: Bancha is the traditional daily green tea found throughout Japan. Made of mature tea leaves and stems from the autumn harvest, Bancha is gently pan-roasted to develop a nutty sweet flavor and golden infusion. Bancha makes a wonderfully quenching cold brew tea and has a mild caffeine level due to its roasting process.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Bancha

Flavor: Tender green tealeaves infused with the lush, alluring fragrance of fresh jasmine blossoms during the moonlit evenings of late summer.
Description: Beginning in the spring of 2015, we worked with our partners in China to develop a completely new style of Jasmine tea that we call Moonlight Jasmine. This superior quality jasmine tea uses less rounds of scenting than Jasmine Pearl, but is equally beautiful to behold visually and even more stunning in its lush, abundantly aromatic sweetness. This innovative tea is made from pure spring harvest tea buds – the same buds that are typically used to make Jasmine Pearl – but are left in a natural, slightly twisted shape instead of being rolled into a pearl. The result is a tea with an unimaginably rich sweetness that naturally complements the sweet perfume of Jasmine. Because Moonlight Jasmine is not rolled into a pearl, far fewer rounds of scenting are needed to achieve a deeply fixed floral aroma. With its elegant visual appearance, Organic Moonlight Jasmine is sure to become the next beloved style of Jasmine tea.
Ingredients: Organic green tea with jasmine
Name: Moonlight Jasmine

Flavor: Sweet honey and flowery top notes of orchids linger amidst a delightfully quenching body characterized by subtle notes of toasted hazelnut and tropical fruits.
Description: Wild Thai Green is an amazingly refreshing and energetic drum-roasted green tea harvested from the antique Assamica gardens of northern Thailand. The elder tea trees growing in this remote micro-climate offer a unique aromatic complexity that reminds tea tasters of the higher grades of sun-dried Saiquing teas from Yunnan.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Wild Thai Green

Flavor: deep and energizing character with rich umami flavor that strikes a balance of savory and bittersweet
Description:
Origin: Nishi-san’s garden, Kirishima Mountain, Kagoshima Prefecture, Japan 
Cultivar: Yabukita
Elevation: 380m
Harvest: April 22, 2021
 
Description:  
The Nishi Family is renowned throughout Japan as pioneers of organic tea cultivation. This year, they selected several specialized lots for us, including this micro-lot of shincha crafted from the Yabukita cultivar. The Yabukita cultivar is the primary cultivar grown in all of Japan and was developed in the 1970s. Kabuse shade wrap cultivation enhances the lovely green leaf color of Yabukita and brings out its deep and energizing character with rich umami flavor that strikes a balance of savory and bittersweet. This tea showcases the rich soil, rustic natural style and forest mountain terroir of the Nishi family’s tea.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Nishi-san’s Single Cultivar Yabukita Shincha
Origin: Nishi-san's Garden, Kirishima Mountain, Kagoshima Prefecture, Japan

Flavor: A refreshing, fruity and floral  blend of green tea with tropical  herbs and citrus
Description: Orange Blossom features fragrant jasmine green tea blended with citrusy herbs like lemongrass and lemon myrtle. The essence of orange, lime and tangerine add zesty brightness, with subtle hints of rose lending high floral notes. Altogether, Orange Blossom uplifts the palate with its inviting aroma.
Ingredients: Organic green tea with jasmine, organic lemongrass, organic lemon myrtle, essential orange oil, natural rose extract, essential lime and tangerine oils
Name: Orange Blossom

Flavor: full flavored and complex with salinity, richness of umami and a reverberating sweet and savory aftertaste. The notes of kombu dashi, top grade shiitake are deep and balanced the expression of Okabe mountain tea
Description:
Origin: Okabe, Fujieda, Shizuoka prefecture, Japan
Cultivar: Yabukita
Elevation: 100m
Harvest : May 3, 2021

Gyokuro, literally “jade dew,” is the most prestigious and rare shade-grown green tea from Japan This year we selected gyokuro from three producers in the Okabe region: Tohei San, Maejima San and Omura San Each teamaker offers an expression of the classic Okabe style, which emphasizes a unique mountain freshness balanced with umami depth. Omura San, a living legend and national treasure of the Japanese tea industry, has been making gyokuro for nearly 70 years. He represents a very high level of artisan tea-making experience and skills. He employs the classic style of straw-thatch-and-frame tana coverings to shade his gyokuro, and his tea has a rarefied depth and energy. This year, Omura San’s Gyokuro is full flavored and complex with mountain salinity, minerality, richness of umami and a reverberating sweet and savory aftertaste. This tea offers lots of tasting notes and energy for gyokuro lovers that transcends the usual profile of gyokuro. Omura San makes a few qualities and grades of gyokuro each year and we selected his top quality or top grade from 2021.
Ingredients: null
Name: Omura San's Top Grade Gyokuro

Flavor: Lilac, Wen Shan Bao Zhong oolong, Hyacinth hydrosol
Description:
Origin: Tenryu, Shizuoka, Japan
Cultivar: Zai Rai
Elevation: 350-500m
Harvest: May 14, 2021

Kamairicha (farmer’s sickle-shaped tea) is a special type of steamed and pan fired green tea from Japan. It is noted for a balance of nutty sweetness with a slight citrus touch. Zai Rai tea trees are essentially an heirloom tea variety that are specific to the local area. Zai Rai tea is naturally propagated over many decades and takes on a character that is only found in this region. It is a real expression of terroir. In recent years, farmers have selected the best from among these indigenous cultivars to farm again to revive a bit of ancient tea history.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Tenryu Zai Rai

Flavor: Golden infusion with a toasty aroma and nutty flavor
Description: Genmaicha originated centuries ago when Buddhist monks mixed green tea with the browned rice stuck to the bottom of their rice cauldrons in a gesture of humility and conservation. Soon after, tea vendors throughout Japan began blending sencha and bancha with roasted rice, creating a widely popular green tea that is perfect at breakfast time or as a daily drinking green tea for additional substance. Our Genmaicha is made with roasted sticky rice for a rich nutty sweetness that blends perfectly with the fresh flavor of sencha.
Ingredients: Organic green tea, and organic roasted sticky rice
Name: Genmaicha

Description: Enjoy the clean, refreshing taste and uplifting energy of matcha in this simple cold format.  Each plant-based sachet is filled with premium stone-milled Japanese matcha and tencha - the shade grown leafy green tea that is ground to make matcha.  Combining matcha with tencha give the double benefit of rich slow-brewed whole tea leaves with the extra punch of matcha powder
Ingredients: Japanese Green Tea.  Cultivars - Okumidori, Yabukita, Kanayamidori, Tsuyuhikari
Name: Cold Brew Matcha
Type: Organic tencha leaves and matcha powder

Flavor: fresh and dewy with rich umami, distinctive minerality and enlivening bittersweetness
Description:
Origin: Utoguchi, Kagoshima Prefecture, Japan
Cultivar: Asanoka, Yabukita, Saemidori
Harvest: April 19-21
Elevation: 300m-380m

This sencha selection comes from the southern island prefecture of Kagoshima, home to active volcanos. The area is renowned for its mineral-rich soils, which contribute to the vibrancy and taste of the tea.

The Yabukita cultivar is the primary cultivar grown in all of Japan. The Asanoka cultivar is a special hybrid of Yabukita and a China bush variety, developed in the 1990s in Kagoshima. Asanoka is regarded for its unique aromatic complexity, density of flavor and rich green infusion. Saemidori translates to “bright green” and produces a vivid bright green liquor, with a remarkably fresh-savory flavor profile.

The blend was steamed as a chumushi (medium steaming), which highlights the combination of cultivars. This selection tastes fresh and dewy with rich umami, distinctive minerality and enlivening bittersweetness
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Utoguchi Cultivar Blend Sencha

Flavor: This blend creates a youthful feeling, evoking the freshness of spring vegetables and tender green herbs, tied together with the lovely top note of sweet jasmine flowers.
Description: Blue Jasmine is an enchanting blend of gorgeous Butterfly Pea Flower from Thailand and alluring Moonlight Jasmine green tea from Yunnan, China. The fresh jasmine blossom aroma and delicate sweetness of the tea buds in Moonlight Jasmine make a perfect complement to the naturally pleasant herbaceous notes of Butterfly Pea Flowers, with their hints of edamame and pea shoots. This blend creates a youthful feeling, evoking the freshness of spring vegetables and tender green herbs, tied together with the lovely top note of sweet jasmine flowers. Butterfly Pea Flowers release their brilliant blue anthocyanin antioxidant pigment into the infusion, which can change before your eyes into a luscious fuchsia with the addition of an acid like lemon or lime. Blue Jasmine makes a wonderful tea for exploration in mixology or other culinary creativity.
Ingredients: Organic green tea with jasmine, butterfly pea flower.
Name: Blue Jasmine

Flavor: Smooth, steamed green tea blended with tart hibiscus and succulent raspberries
Description: Vibrant steamed green tea blended with tart hibiscus and succulent raspberries. Raspberry Green Tea offers a sweet and jammy character that tastes delicious hot or iced. Add a squeeze of lemon or dash of pomegranate juice for an extra vibrant garnish.
Ingredients: Organic green tea, organic raspberry, organic hibiscus flowers, organic raspberry flavor
Name: Raspberry Green Tea

Flavor: Tender tea leaves, hand-rolled and deeply infused with the sweet aroma of jasmine blossoms.
Description: Our Jasmine Pearls are comprised of tender, hand-rolled tea buds from the spring harvest that are deeply scented with fresh jasmine blossoms. Drawing upon rich and savory Fuding tea buds and sweet and fruity Yunnan tea buds, our Jasmine Pearls have a unique, complex base that marries beautifully with the lush jasmine aroma.
Ingredients: Green tea with jasmine
Name: Jasmine Pearls

Flavor: the perfect blend of green enlivening Japanese matcha and sweetness
Description: Enjoy the enlivening, clean energy of authentic stone-milled Japanese Matcha blended with pure cane sugar.  Our special blend dissolves easily into your favorite barista style drink, hot or cold.
Ingredients:
Cane sugar, Japanese green tea

Nutritional Facts: 
Serving size 1Tbsp (13g), Calories 50, Total fat 0g (0% DV), Saturated Fat 0g (0% DV), Trans Fat 0g, Cholesterol 0mg (0%DV), Sodium 35mg (1% DV), Total Carb. 12g (4% DV), Dietary Fiber 0g (0% DV), Total Sugars 12g, Includes 12g Added Sugars (35% DV), Protein 0g
Name: Sweet Matcha

Flavor: Invigorating flavor with a pure emerald hue and hints of spruce.
Description:
Origin: Uji-Shirakawa, Kyoto, Japan
Cultivar: Gokou
Elevation: 250m
Harvest: May 12, 2020

Rishi is lucky enough to be one of the few to whom Tsuji-san sells his matcha, which has been analyzed to have the highest amino acids scores and L-theanine content of any matcha in Japan and the world. Each cultivar gives us specific tasting notes. In Tsuji-san's Matcha Gokou, we experience an invigorating flavor with a pure emerald hue and hints of spruce. Tea bushes for premium matcha are harvested once per year. The farming technique is unique as it utilizes shading, and this focuses the plant's energy on the top, tender leaves. The intense shading forces the bushes to make their leaves fatter and greener, with increased chlorophyll to seek out the sun. In turn, this farming practice greatly enhances the nootropic and neuro-stimulating substances.

Makers Spotlight: Tsuji-san's Matcha
Ingredients: Japanese green tea.
Name: Tsuji-san's Matcha Gokou

Flavor: Savory and bittersweet, sweet corn, caramelized baked sweet potato, orchid with aromas reminiscent of shishito peppers
Description: Origin: Suoi Giang, Yen Bai Province, Northern Vietnam Cultivar: Yen Bai Ancient Trees Elevation: 1500m Harvest: Spring 2021 This early spring, high mountain micro-lot is from ancient tea trees harvested by the Hmong Ethnic people located in Suoi Giang, Yen Bai in Northern Vietnam. Shan Tuyết translates as “Snow Mountain” and references the clouds and cold foggy mists where these old trees grow. Snow Shan teas are not inherently named for their processing method and plucking standard but are better defined by the ancient tea trees, high elevation and how they grow. The tea leaves are coated in snow white silvery down, and the trees themselves are large and gnarled, covered in misty dew, lichen, moss and wild orchids. The trees have a unique look and patina with their frosted, snow white flora. The ancient trees of Yen Bai Province are highly revered in Vietnam and China for the complexity of the tannin structure and the overall taste of tea these trees produce. The downy bud-and-a-leaf are processed using a technique similar to Ban Hong Chao, creating a curled tea leaf with a frosted appearance. Don’t let the delicate nature of the tea fool you—the tea has a vibrant, energizing feel. DISCOVER THE SNOW SHAN ORIGIN STORY
Ingredients: Green tea
Name: Yen Bai Shan Tuyet Green Tea
Origin: Suoi Giang, Yen Bai Province, Northern Vietnam
Link: Yen Bai Shan Tuyet Green Tea

Flavor: vibrant green with delicate umami undertones
Description:
Matcha is the shade-grown, stone-ground green tea powder of Japan, celebrated for its vibrant, healthful energy and vivid green color. Ceremonial Matcha is high grade matcha that is traditional whisked and served in a bowl.
BENEFITS OF RISHI MATCHA
Mental FocusClean EnergyRefreshing Taste AntioxidantsAmino Acids Low AstringencyLow Bitterness
Ingredients:
Japanese green tea. Saemidori, Okumidori and Tsuyuhikari cultivars.

Nutritional Facts:
 Serving size 1tsp (2g) Calories 10, Total fat 0g (0% DV), Saturated Fat 0g (0% DV), Trans Fat 0g, Cholesterol 0mg (0%DV), Sodium 0mg (0% DV), Total Carb. Less than 1g (0% DV), Dietary Fiber less than 1g (2% DV), Total Sugars 0g, Includes 0g Added Sugars (0% DV), Protein less than 1g (not a significant source of protein), Vitamin D 0mcg (0% DV), Calcium 5mg (0% DV), Iron 0mg (0% DV), Potassium 50mg (2% DV)
Name: Ceremonial Matcha

Flavor: Sakura mochi, energizing bittersweetness with spring floral notes and hints of chrysanthemum
Description:
Origin: Shimizu, Shizuoka prefecture, Japan
Cultivar: Shizu-7132 ""Machiko""
Elevation: 200m
Harvest Date: May 1, 2021

Japan is one of the many countries renowned for its tea agriculture and analysis of both existing and new cultivars. The Machiko cultivar, developed in the late 60’s and early ‘70s, is prized by Japanese tea lovers for its distinctive cherry blossom aroma. Recently, Japanese food scientists identified the aromatic and antioxidant compound coumarin in Machiko tea leaves as responsible for the unique aromatics associated with this cultivar.

Mr. Sugiyama cultivated our Machiko selection and is the only farmer in Shizuoka who grows Machiko according to certified organic practices. This 2021 Crop first flush micro-lot offers intense notes of sakura mochi, cherry blossoms, fresh almonds and anisette cookies with a remarkable balance of bittersweet and umami. It is very lively and stimulating with refreshingly low tannin and smooth aftertaste. It is very lively and stimulating with refreshingly low tannin and smooth aftertaste.
Ingredients: Green tea
Name: Sugiyama-san's Shincha Single Cultivar Machiko

Flavor: A lively, delicious everyday green  tea nurtured by the clouds and  cool mist of early spring
Description: Jade Cloud is a lively green tea that we created over a decade ago in collaboration with artisans at the Xuan En Organic Yisheng Tea Cooperative in the remote mountains of Hubei province. Three different styles of green tea (steamed, oven-baked and roasted) are combined to make a deliciously smooth everyday green tea inspired by the classic Chinese green tea known as Wulu. Jade Cloud is grown from hardy tea cultivars like Long Jing #43 and Hubei E-Cha #10, and is harvested entirely by hand from the middle to the end of April according to ""two leaves and a bud"" plucking standard. Savory notes from steamed tea leaves are expertly balanced with the toasted chestnut flavor and flowery aromas of baked and roasted lots.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Jade Cloud

Flavor: Refreshing and brisk with a pleasant bitter-sweetness, deep umami flavor and a greenish-golden infusion color
Description: The Nishi family's teas are celebrated throughout Japan for their exquisite quality and dedication to organic cultivation techniques and masterful cultivar selection. We have partnered with the Nishi family for over a decade of sustainable tea farming, working with them to establish some of the first organic tea farms in southern Japan. This is Nishi's premier asamushi style steamed sencha with a bright, lively character that is only found in the first flush. The ""first flush"" refers to the first harvests of the spring season when new tea buds emerge and tea plants awake from winter dormancy. At this time, the bushes sprout up with great vigor and yield the richest, most balanced teas. Vivid and juicy, Nishi First Flush Sencha presents a dewy umami flavor and smooth mouthfeel.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Nishi First Flush Sencha

Flavor: Artichoke, edamame, brisk bitter sweetness and rich umami
Description:
Origin: Jin Long Ping village, Xuan En county, Hubei province, China
Cultivar: Long Jing #43
Elevation: 750-800m
Harvest: March 20th, 2021

This green tea is crafted from the famed Long Jing #43 cultivar. The processing method of this tea was adapted from an old style steamed green tea known as Enshi Yulu (Jade Dew from Enshi). Jade Dew from the Enshi region was a Tribute Tea during the Qing dynasty and is considered one of the historical precursors of temomi sencha and early gyokuro.

It was made by steaming, cooling down, hand-kneading the leaf into a pristine pine needle shape and then gently drying on heated tables until the shape and aroma is fixed. The result is a vibrant, full-bodied and fresh character with plenty of umami characteristic of spring green tea. It is said that during the 1600s, Japanese Taoist students traveling in this Enshi region (famous for its remote forests and Taoist temples) experienced this green tea process and took inspiration back to Japan for the making of sencha and refined steamed teas.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Yulu Jade Dew
Origin: Jin Long Ping Village, Xuan'En County, Hubei Province, China

Flavor: A premium, rich genmaicha infused with Japanese matcha for an extra creamy cup
Description: Genmaicha is a staple tea of Japan and Korea made by blending sencha and bancha green teas with roasted rice. Traditional genmaicha has a mellow, toasty flavor that goes well with any meal. We infuse genmaicha with Japanese matcha green tea powder for a remarkably palatable cup with a vivid green infusion. With its fresh energy balanced with creamy sweetness, Matcha Genmaicha makes for a perfect ""green breakfast"" tea.
Ingredients: Organic green tea and organic roasted sticky rice, organic matcha green tea
Name: Matcha Genmaicha

Flavor: Our top grade of organic matcha is made from the first springtime harvest of tencha, savored for its umami sweetness, creamy taste and enlivening energy
Description:
Our top grade of organic matcha is made from the first springtime harvest of tencha, savored for its umami sweetness, creamy taste and enlivening energy. Prepare Teahouse Matcha in the traditional, ceremonial manner called Cha No Yu using a tea bowl and a bamboo tea whisk.

The traditional cultivation of tencha requires shading the tea garden for 3-4 weeks prior to harvest. This elevates chlorophyll and enhances L-theanine and other stimulating amino acids responsible for matcha's unique bounty of energy.

Tencha is made from tea strains specifically cultivated to be:
- low in tannin
- high in caffeine
- rich in flavor and umami.
Ingredients: Organic Japanese green tea
Name: Teahouse Matcha

Description:
Origin: Nishi-san’s garden, Kirishima Mountain, Kagoshima Prefecture, Japan
Cultivar: Okumidori
Elevation: 300m
Harvest: April 28, 2021


The Nishi Family is renowned throughout Japan as pioneers of organic tea cultivation, and this year, they selected several specialized lots for us, including this micro-lot of shincha crafted from the Okumidori cultivar. Okumidori translates as “deep green” and is a hybrid of Yabukita and a Shizuoka Zai Rai, which was developed in the 1970s and entered into the tea registry. This later harvest tea type matures to flush in mid-spring after Yabukita.

This chumushi (mid-steamed) shincha offers a balance of freshness and umami with a creamy, toasted hazelnut note from particular roasting, enhanced with Kabuse (wrapped shading) to bring out deep sweetness and special aromas. This Okumidori has a deep, blue-green jade leaf hued infusion and a moderate, elegant tannin, deep umami and complex taste.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Nishi-san’s Single Cultivar Okumidori Shincha
Origin: Nishi-san's Garden, Kirishima Mountain, Kagoshima Prefecture, Japan

Flavor: Fresh, grassy high notes with a smooth body, savory flavor and crisp finish
Description: Sencha Superior is made from the predominant Yabukita cultivar of Shizuoka, Japan and offers the classic, bittersweet and balanced umami flavor that represents the original Japanese Sencha taste profile. Sencha Superior is mostly from high grown gardens in Shizuoka and undergoes a light steaming process called asamushi that is employed by tea farmers to preserve the tea's inherent varietal and origin characteristics. The clear, golden-green and brisk infusion of Sencha Superior is fresh and lively with a savory-sweet and crisp finish.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Sencha Superior

Flavor: Velvety mouthfeel with hints of macadamia nut and kombu.
Description:
Origin: Uji-Shirakawa, Kyoto, Japan
Cultivar: Asahi
Elevation: 250m
Harvest: May 7, 2020 

Rishi is lucky enough to be one of the few to whom Tsuji-san sells his matcha, which has been analyzed to have the highest amino acids scores and L-theanine content of any matcha in Japan and the world. Each cultivar gives us specific tasting notes. In Tsuji-san's Matcha Asahi, we experience a velvety mouthfeel with hints of macadamia nut and kombu. Tea bushes for premium matcha are harvested once per year. The farming technique is unique as it utilizes shading, and this focuses the plant's energy on the top, tender leaves. The intense shading forces the bushes to make their leaves fatter and greener, with increased chlorophyll to seek out the sun. In turn, this farming practice greatly enhances the nootropic and neuro-stimulating substances.

Makers Spotlight: Tsuji-san's Matcha
Ingredients: Japanese green tea.
Name: Tsuji-san's Matcha Asahi

Flavor: Cherry blossoms, deep density of flavor with balance of freshness, with  minerality and lasting aroma
Description:
Origin: Uchimaki, Shizuoka, Japan
Harvest: April 20, 2021
Cultivar: Koushun
Elevation: 150m

This micro-lot of the Koushun cultivar is mid-steamed and exudes a great balance of bitter-sweetness, umami flavor and refreshing mountain minerality. Koushun was bred from the Mother of Kurosawa and the Father of Kanayamidori tea bushes. It has the natural tendency to make aromatic teas with its wide ranging aromatic compounds that waft fruits, spices, resinous woods and flowering cherry (sakura).
Ingredients: Green tea
Name: Uchimaki Single Cultivar Koushun

Flavor: Amber colored infusion with a smooth flavor and accents of chocolate and roasted barley
Description: Houjicha is a traditional style of Japanese green tea made with bancha tea leaves from the autumn and winter harvests. An additional hot roasting step transforms bancha by way of the maillard reaction into light brown leaves that brew an amber-red infusion. While it looks dark, Houjicha is technically a green tea, offering a uniquely smooth flavor with accents of chocolate, coffee and roasted barley. The roasting step also slightly lowers the caffeine level, making for a mild cup that is delicious any time of day or night.
Ingredients: Organic green tea
Name: Houjicha

Flavor: Fresh and soothing green tea scented with the enchanting aroma of jasmine blossoms
Description: Jasmine tea is the most popular flower-scented tea in East Asia. Its enchanting, unforgettable aroma is created through an artisanal method of tea scenting that dates back more than 800 years. Jasmine blossoms are gathered during midsummer evenings and spread amongst tea leaves over several successive nights. Because dried tea leaves are hygroscopic, they readily absorb floral essences like jasmine. Our Jasmine Green features a base tea grown by our partners at the Xuan En Yisheng Tea Cooperative, which is prized for its high mountain character and elegant sweetness. Refreshingly fragrant, jasmine has been regarded as the perfect digestif tea for centuries.
Ingredients: Organic green tea with jasmine
Name: Jasmine Green Tea

Flavor: Lively, cocoa, dark bittersweet chocolate, crème anglaise, whipped cream, deep umami balanced with amazing tannin structure and finishes with evergreen complexity
Description:
Origin: Uji, Kyoto, Japan
Cultivar: Saemidori, Samidori & Gokou
Elevation: 11 meters
Harvest: 2020

Nakanishi-San is a renowned tea producer from Uji, who cultivates tea along the Uji River. Tea from this region tends to emphasize depth and resonance of flavor. The richness of umami taste with savory and sweet flavors akin to kombu, snap pea, hijiki and mushroom-dashi are a real highlight. These lower elevations have warmer soil, which is favored when producing shade-grown teas like Tencha and Gyokuro.

Nakanishi-San's farm is over 300 years old and is JAS certified and organic accredited for more than 30 years. The farm is known for stellar soil management and organic cultivation techniques that result in one of the world's best organic sources of authentic, ceremonial matcha. This matcha features a vibrant blue-green color, and we are enjoying the complexity of this lively matcha with notes of cocoa, dark bittersweet chocolate, crème anglaise and whipped cream.
Ingredients: Green Tea Powder
Name: Nakanishi san’s Uji Matcha

Flavor: This brain tonic energizes deeply with uplifting Matcha green tea and a zesty buzz of ginger, with fragrant peaks of rosemary and yuzu citrus.
Description: This stimulating Matcha blend elevates the senses with a special combination of ingredients designed to activate the central nervous system. The rich L-theanine amino acid contents from Japanese Matcha and Sencha promote concentration, mental clarity, and focus. Premium rosemary provides a nervine tonic charge and stimulates activity in the limbic system of the brain, which is linked to memory formation and emotional response. Ginger and yuzu citrus peel provide zesty, warming accents and integrate an amazingly fragrant and complex range of essential oils.
Ingredients: Organic ginger root, organic green tea, organic quince, organic rosemary, organic yuzu peel, organic black pepper, essential grapefruit, ginger, coriander, and essential makrut lime oil
Name: Matcha Ginger Buzz

Flavor: Brilliant expression of floral aromas in an elegant structure.
Description:
Origin: Shizuoka, Japan
Cultivar: Yabukita
Elevation: 350m
Harvest: May 3, 2021

Honyama is a notable distinction of sencha from a high mountain region of Shizuoka, Japan. Okouchi is a small town within this region which was historically significant as one of the premium cultivation sites of tribute tea for the Emperor. Our partners keep up with rare practices of handpicking and light steaming with mountain spring water to honor the traditions of this prestigious tea region.

The valley farms and cool, foggy weather provide a special quality of tea that exudes the phenomenon known as Yamano Kaori, literally ""mountain aroma."" The mists shroud the tea bushes during peak harvesting season, which enhances the floral aromas in the tea and allows for gradual growth, concentrating amino acids and reducing sharp tannin.

Yamano Kaori is understood as ""mountain character"" by Japanese tasting experts and is defined by the balance of bittersweetness and mild briskness of tannin. The infusion is lustrous with a lemony-lime yellow hue, has stimulating springtime energy and high levels of umami, amino acids and sweetness.
Ingredients: null
Name: Honyama Okouchi Sencha

Flavor: Tender tea leaves, hand-rolled and deeply infused with the sweet aroma of jasmine blossoms.
Description: Our Jasmine Pearls are comprised of tender, hand-rolled tea buds from the spring harvest that are deeply scented with fresh jasmine blossoms. Drawing upon rich and savory Fuding tea buds and sweet and fruity Yunnan tea buds, our Jasmine Pearls have a unique, complex base that marries beautifully with the lush jasmine aroma.
Ingredients: Green tea with jasmine
Name: Jasmine Pearls

Flavor: Enlivening heat with a bright, spicy lemony aroma
Description: Ginger is one of the principal ingredients in the traditional herbal medicines and food cultures of Asia. Each year we taste ginger from a range of origins to select only the most zesty and energizing. We seek a specific balance of enlivening, pungent spicy heat with a bright, lemony aroma.
Ingredients: Organic ginger root
Name: Ginger

Flavor: sweet, sour, juicy, herbaceous, succulent fruits
Description: This potent blend of Patagonian cranberry, grapefruit, yuzu, schisandra and rosemary is juicy and tart with the right balance of bitter and aromatics. The cranberry Rishi sources is from the Chilean Patagonia and freeze-dried, creating an amazing, sumptuous cranberry flavor like no other. Citrus fruits, including peels, fruits, and seeds, have been used in medicinal tonics in many Eastern countries including China, Japan and Korea. Yuzu is a bright and aromatic citrus fruit known for its powerful immune-boosting function. Rosemary is widely studied and regarded as a nootropic, powerful antioxidant and anti-inflammatory herb, and the medicinal uses of rosemary dates back to the 16th century. Schisandra berry is a well-known adaptogen, aiding the body in de-stressing. Scientists have been researching this berry for years, with a plethora of studies to back up myriad health benefits. The synergy of these ingredients is rewarding both in flavor and function.
Ingredients: cranberries, organic yuzu peel, organic schisandra berries, organic grapefruit peel, organic rosemary
Name: Chilean Cranberry Citrus

Flavor: An enlivening blend of golden turmeric with spicy ginger and zesty citrus
Description:
The awesome, centering energy of golden turmeric root is enhanced by strengthening licorice root and zesty ginger in this Ayurveda inspired blend. Fragrant lemongrass and citrus peels create a lemon drop candy sweetness that balances the pungency of the roots. The combination of turmeric, ginger, lemon and honey is an ancient herbal recipe for longevity, stamina and balance.

On the go? Check out our Turmeric Ginger Tea Bags.
Ingredients: Organic ginger root, organic turmeric root, organic licorice root, organic lemongrass, organic orange peel, organic lemon peel, essential orange and lemon oils
Name: Turmeric Ginger

Description: Do you love your chai hot and extra spicy? Spicy Masala Chai is designed for you. We added cayenne chili flakes in addition to a double concentration of ginger to deliver a thoroughly warming chai experience. Classic aromatic accents of cloves, cinnamon and cardamom add rich depth.
Ingredients: organic cardamom, organic ginger root, organic cinnamon, organic black tea, organic black pepper, organic cloves, organic chili flakes, essential ginger oil
Name: Spicy Masala Chai

Flavor: Notes of blackberry and fig distinguish this singular blend of Pu'er tea and red wine varietal grape skins
Description:
This artistic blend honors the cultural parallels between Pu'er tea and Bordeaux wine—a pair of ancient libations steeped in tradition. Their very names derive from their geographic place of origin: Pu'er county in Yunnan Province, China and Bordeaux city in southwestern France. Whether tea or wine, connoisseurs seek gems that best express the nuances of terroir and vintage. Both Pu'er and Bordeaux benefit from the richening effect of aging, increasing in complexity as time passes on. Together, Pu'er tea and red wine grape skins of various Bordeaux varietals like Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc create a smooth, supple cup with a refined structure and notes of cassis and lavender.

On the go? Check out our Pu'er Bordeaux Tea Bags.
Ingredients: Organic Pu'er tea, organic elderberries, organic hibiscus flowers, organic red wine grape skins, organic blackberries, organic raspberries, organic lavender flowers
Name: Pu'er Bordeaux

Flavor: Refreshingly tart and fruity with a uniquely quenching balance of five flavors: sweet, sour, salty, bitter, pungent.
Description: The Schisandra (also know as Omija) berry is native to northeastern China, Korea and parts of Siberia. It has been cultivated for thousands of years as a special beautifying tonic herb found in numerous traditional culinary and medicinal recipes. Schisandra is celebrated in China and Korea as an adaptogen—herbs that alleviate stress and help the body deal with physical and mental fatigue. The adaptogenic properties of schisandra have been cited for centuries in Asian tradition for helping beautify and protect the skin from environmental stress. It is also said that schisandra's concentrated B-vitamin complex and antioxidant activity help support healthy liver function and hormonal balance. Schisandra is harvested in late summer and can be pressed fresh into juice or sun-dried for use in a variety of preparations such as herbal teas, vitality tonics and infused liquors. Schisandra literally means ""five-flavor berry,"" alluding to its uniquely complex flavor profile with sweet, sour, salty, bitter and pungent aspects found in different parts of the berry.
Ingredients: Organic schisandra berries
Name: Schisandra Berries

Flavor: Delicately sweet quince, wild murta guava, and jammy strawberry provide a luscious flavor that is taken to greater heights with soothing linden flowers and eucalyptus.
Description: Embrace the thrill of pristine mountain air with a taste of Patagonia Wild Guava. This blend is perfect for explorers and adventurers of all kinds. A rare type of guava called murta is wild-collected from the biodiverse forests of southern Chile. We expertly blend murta with quince, linden flowers, and eucalyptus for a deliciously quenching brew that soothes respiration at altitude. Patagonians combine murta and quince to make a traditional fruit jam called conserva de murta y membrillos that pairs perfectly with a cheese course.
Ingredients: Organic Chilean wild guava, organic quince, organic linden flowers, organic strawberries, organic eucalyptus
Name: Patagonia Wild Guava

Flavor: Sweet, soothing rooibos, complemented by refreshing, aromatic peppermint
Description: Peppermint Rooibos makes a deep red infusion with a smooth, rich mouthfeel and fresh minty sweetness that underlines the finer points of peppermint. The slightest touch of bergamot harmonizes these herbs, highlighting the soothing aroma of peppermint with the sweet and silky character of rooibos.
Ingredients: Organic rooibos, organic peppermint, essential bergamot oil
Name: Peppermint Rooibos

Flavor: Rich and malty with a smooth, sweet vanilla finish
Description: Decadent and creamy, this is the ultimate vanilla forward black tea. We blend a malty, smooth-bodied tea from Yunnan with premium vanilla and high quality chopped vanilla bean to create a silky, layered taste experience. Our Vanilla Bean is cured before release for a harmonized and integrated flavor.
Ingredients: Organic black tea, organic vanilla bean, natural vanilla flavor
Name: Vanilla Bean

Flavor: Smooth, steamed green tea blended with tart hibiscus and succulent raspberries
Description: Vibrant steamed green tea blended with tart hibiscus and succulent raspberries. Raspberry Green Tea offers a sweet and jammy character that tastes delicious hot or iced. Add a squeeze of lemon or dash of pomegranate juice for an extra vibrant garnish.
Ingredients: Organic green tea, organic raspberry, organic hibiscus flowers, organic raspberry flavor
Name: Raspberry Green Tea

Flavor: complex tannin structure, tuberose and jasmine with a heady citrus scent, rich aftertaste and strong energy
Description:
Origin: Ha Giang Province Province, Vietnam 
Cultivar: Localized Shan Thuyet variety  
Harvest: Spring 2020 Scented February 2021 
Elevation: 1200m  

Pomelo citrus blossom scented green tea is a marvelous experience for traditional flower-scented tea enthusiasts. Pomelo citrus trees have elegant and deeply fragrant blossoms that bloom before bearing delicious grapefruit-like fruits. The flowers are used to scent tea in the similar fashion as jasmine blossoms or roses are used traditionally scent green tea. 
  
High mountain, first flush green tea from Northern Vietnam is scented with the fresh blossoms of pomelo and aged with a small content of the dried pomelo tree flowers.
Ingredients: Scented green tea
Name: Pomelo Blossom Green Tea

Flavor: A punchy hibiscus blend with  zesty, revitalizing ginger and  succulent citrus.
Description:
Tangerine Ginger combines roots, fruits and herbs to create a vibrant vitality tonic. Invigorating ginger and licorice are balanced with tart rosehips and succulent tangerine. Real citrus peels awaken the senses with rejuvenating energy that is perfectly complemented by wild-harvested adaptogenic schisandra berry.

Learn more about the many beneficial ingredients in this tea.

On the go? Check out our Tangerine Ginger Tea Bags.
Ingredients: Organic hibiscus flowers, organic ginger root, organic rosehips, organic licorice root, organic orange peel, organic schisandra berries, essential tangerine and orange oils
Name: Tangerine Ginger

Flavor: Brisk and malty black tea with lofty rose notes
Description:
Luxuriate in the aromas of rose in this premium black tea offering. Our top grade of Yunnan Dianhong black tea is scented with red roses in Yunnan featuring an addition of Moroccan rose petals, blended in-house. The black tea is masterfully processed to achieve a rich auburn color flecked with golden buds, highlighted by the pinkish-red hued petals. The elegant tannin structure of the tea is further uplifted with the intoxicating scent of rose.  
 
Morocco is renowned throughout the world as one of the premiere origins of roses, while Yunnan China, is heralded as the birthplace of tea. This propriety blend is delightful when served straight and divine with milk and sugar or prepared as a milk tea. The combination delivers a sumptuous cup, perfect to gift to a loved one or to yourself.
Ingredients: Organic black tea, organic rose petals
Name: Rose-scented Dianhong Black Tea
Origin: Wa Shan, Cangyuan county, Yunnan province, China

Flavor: Roasted dandelion root provides a bittersweet cacao profile, which is enriched with fermented Pu'er and oolong teas. Saigon cinnamon simmers with sweetness, while lemon provides cleansing balance. Finishes with uplifting hints of rose geranium.
Description: Dandelion Detox is a sophisticated mash-up of traditional Chinese slimming teas and detox herb tea blends from Western herbalism. Fermented Pu'er tea and oolong tea are often enjoyed during or after dim sum in Hong Kong. In China, these teas are said to ""cut the grease"" and help the body digest rich foods. Dandelion root is an herb that is traditionally known to support detoxification. Cinnamon energizes the blend, while a hint of citrus provides quenching replenishment to restore balance.
Ingredients: Organic roasted dandelion root, organic black limon, organic Pu'er tea, organic oolong tea, organic cinnamon, organic ginger root, organic schisandra berries, essential geranium oil
Name: Dandelion Detox

Flavor: A tropical take on turmeric featuring luscious and juicy Sri Lanka mango, tangy sweet pineapple, fragrant yuzu citrus peel and exotic top notes of jasmine and makrut lime .
Description: A tropical take on turmeric featuring luscious and juicy Sri Lanka mango, tangy sweet pineapple, fragrant yuzu citrus peel and exotic top notes of jasmine and makrut lime.
Ingredients: Organic mango, organic turmeric root, organic pineapple, organic ginger root, organic green tea with jasmine, natural mango flavor, essential makrut lime oil
Name: Turmeric Mango

Flavor: Fresh and soothing green tea scented with the enchanting aroma of jasmine blossoms
Description: Jasmine tea is the most popular flower-scented tea in East Asia. Its enchanting, unforgettable aroma is created through an artisanal method of tea scenting that dates back more than 800 years. Jasmine blossoms are gathered during midsummer evenings and spread amongst tea leaves over several successive nights. Because dried tea leaves are hygroscopic, they readily absorb floral essences like jasmine. Our Jasmine Green features a base tea grown by our partners at the Xuan En Yisheng Tea Cooperative, which is prized for its high mountain character and elegant sweetness. Refreshingly fragrant, jasmine has been regarded as the perfect digestif tea for centuries.
Ingredients: Organic green tea with jasmine
Name: Jasmine Green Tea

Flavor: A succulent rooibos blend with sweet blueberries and revitalizing schisandra berries
Description:
This Rishi original highlights the robust flavor of rooibos with fruity notes of elderberries, blueberries and hibiscus to create a tart yet sweet herbal blend. Schisandra berries add a layer of aromatic complexity with wild floral notes and cranberry-like tartness.

On the go? Check out our Blueberry Hibiscus (Blueberry Rooibos) Tea Bags.
Ingredients: Organic rooibos, organic elderberries, organic hibiscus flowers, organic currants, organic blueberries, natural blueberry flavor, organic schisandra berries, natural strawberry flavor
Name: Blueberry Rooibos

Flavor: This brain tonic energizes deeply with uplifting Matcha green tea and a zesty buzz of ginger, with fragrant peaks of rosemary and yuzu citrus.
Description: This stimulating Matcha blend elevates the senses with a special combination of ingredients designed to activate the central nervous system. The rich L-theanine amino acid contents from Japanese Matcha and Sencha promote concentration, mental clarity, and focus. Premium rosemary provides a nervine tonic charge and stimulates activity in the limbic system of the brain, which is linked to memory formation and emotional response. Ginger and yuzu citrus peel provide zesty, warming accents and integrate an amazingly fragrant and complex range of essential oils.
Ingredients: Organic ginger root, organic green tea, organic quince, organic rosemary, organic yuzu peel, organic black pepper, essential grapefruit, ginger, coriander, and essential makrut lime oil
Name: Matcha Ginger Buzz

Flavor: This blend creates a youthful feeling, evoking the freshness of spring vegetables and tender green herbs, tied together with the lovely top note of sweet jasmine flowers.
Description: Blue Jasmine is an enchanting blend of gorgeous Butterfly Pea Flower from Thailand and alluring Moonlight Jasmine green tea from Yunnan, China. The fresh jasmine blossom aroma and delicate sweetness of the tea buds in Moonlight Jasmine make a perfect complement to the naturally pleasant herbaceous notes of Butterfly Pea Flowers, with their hints of edamame and pea shoots. This blend creates a youthful feeling, evoking the freshness of spring vegetables and tender green herbs, tied together with the lovely top note of sweet jasmine flowers. Butterfly Pea Flowers release their brilliant blue anthocyanin antioxidant pigment into the infusion, which can change before your eyes into a luscious fuchsia with the addition of an acid like lemon or lime. Blue Jasmine makes a wonderful tea for exploration in mixology or other culinary creativity.
Ingredients: Organic green tea with jasmine, butterfly pea flower.
Name: Blue Jasmine

Flavor: Golden liquoring infusion with a fragrance reminiscent of honey and fruit blossoms
Description: Chamomile blossoms have a lovely sweet flavor evoking fruit nectar, apple and quince. Known to botanists as German Chamomile, Matricaria recutita has been cultivated and used around the Mediterranean for centuries. We select the peak quality blossoms from the most pristine chamomile growing regions in Eastern Europe.
Ingredients: Organic chamomile flowers
Name: Golden Chamomile Blossoms

Flavor: A robust, full-bodied black  tea blended with aromatic  traditional Indian masala spices
Description:
Literally ""mixed spiced tea,"" Masala Chai is a classic style of black tea blended with traditional spices native to South and Southeast Asia. The tea base consists of a robust and malty Assam balanced with our new, lively Orange Pekoe from northern Thailand. Our recipe is unapologetically spicy yet balanced, highlighting aromatic Guatemalan cardamom, hot and citrusy ginger and sweet cinnamon, with accents of pungent cracked black pepper and fragrant cloves. Designed to be brewed both straight up and via stovetop simmered the traditional way in water and milk often with a touch of sweetness.

On the go? Check out our Masala Chai Tea Bags.
Ingredients: organic black tea, organic cinnamon, organic cardamom, organic ginger root, organic black pepper, organic clove
Name: Masala Chai

Flavor: This delightfully sweet and tangy beauty blend highlights the natural balance of Omija berries with accents of luscious strawberry and succulent rosehips.
Description: Schisandra Berry Blush (formerly Omija Berry Blush) is a gorgeous blend highlighting the remarkable Schisandra berry. Schisandra Berry Blush combines Schisandra with complementary botanicals to make a refreshingly tart, sweet and unforgettably fragrant beauty blend. The lovely collection of pink, purple, blue and scarlet herbs release an inviting blush of rosé color when infused. Accents of lavender, strawberry and Chilean rosehips lend aromatic complexity that ties together in a deeply refreshing and balanced finish. Naturally caffeine free, Schisandra Berry Blush can be enjoyed at any time of day.
Ingredients: Organic schisandra berries, organic strawberries, organic rosehips, organic maqui berries, organic lavender flowers, organic red wine grape skins, organic hibiscus flowers, organic blackberry leaves
Name: Schisandra Berry Blush

Flavor: Energizing Amazonian guayusa with sumptuous coconut and rich cacao
Description: Guayusa has been consumed for centuries by indigenous peoples of the upper Amazon Basin for sustained energy, cultural ritual and medicinal use. Along with yerba mate and yaupon, guayusa is one of the few known species to contain caffeine in the holly genus. The practice of consuming it in the night before a hunt is the root of its nickname the 'night watchman'. Hunters would drink it for its stimulating effect, helping them stay awake and alert through the night. This spirited blend is a great way to kickstart the day or power through all-nighter work sessions.
Ingredients: organic guayusa, organic cocoa shells, organic roasted coconut, organic cocoa nibs, natural coconut flavor, organic passionfruit flavor
Name: Guayusa Cacao

Flavor: Decadent cacao and creamy sarsaparilla with rich coconut and bittersweet dandelion root.
Description: An enticing, chocolatey blend combining strong black tea, dark cocoa shells and nibs with creamy coconut and sarsaparilla for a rich, decadent cup. Designed to be infused straight like tea, or add milk and brew like traditional chai.
Ingredients: Organic black tea, organic coconut flakes, organic cinnamon, organic cocoa shells, organic sarsaparilla root, organic licorice root, organic cocoa nibs, organic roasted dandelion root, organic cloves, natural chocolate flavor
Name: Chocolate Chai

Flavor: Soothing peppermint with a naturally sweet finish from licorice root combined with sweet enlivening basil
Description: This deeply soothing mint blend combines a simple set of ingredients, honoring their inherent complexity for an uplifting cup that refreshes both mind and palate. Bright peppermint and fragrant cardamom are balanced with sweet licorice root and wondrously aromatic notes of basil and clove.
Ingredients: Organic peppermint, organic cardamom, organic licorice root, essential basil and clove leaf oils
Name: Mystic Mint

Flavor: sumptuous and slightly spicy blend with a brilliant scarlet infusion
Description: Strawberry Shiso is a sumptuous and slightly spicy blend with a brilliant scarlet infusion. Shiso is a primary culinary herb in Asia and goes by many names including Japanese mint, wild sesame and Perilla. This ornamental plant is noted for its high antioxidant content and aromatic compounds. From cold and flu prevention to anti-aging, the benefits are effective in supporting the body across all seasons. Paired with bamboo ginger, a special variety of spicy and highly aromatic ginger grown in Taiwan, the synergy of these plants revitalizes and refreshes in hot summer months. These ingredients are then blended with strawberries, hibiscus and lemon myrtle, which contain naturally high levels of antioxidants. The aromas are citrusy with a fruit forward flavor and balanced by the heat of bamboo ginger. Strawberry Shiso can be enjoyed hot or cold.
Ingredients: Organic red shiso, organic strawberries, organic hibiscus, bamboo ginger, organic lemon myrtle
Name: Strawberry Shiso

Flavor: Green plum wine, wild oregano, tarragon, citron and lemon
Description:
Shiso Lemon is a complex flavor experience for the palate but only has two ingredients in the blend--green shiso and California lemon. Shiso, also known as Japanese mint or perilla, is a primary flavor in Japanese, Korean and Chinese cuisine. It is an herb related to the mint family with sub-cultivars that are green or red and purple.

Scientists have recently studied the water infusion of shiso in alternative medicine to restore health and bring balance to the body with its high antioxidant values and aromatic compounds. Other notable uses include cold and flu prevention, skincare, respiratory support and digestive aid. Shiso extracts can be found in high-end skincare products, especially in facial toners and anti-aging serums.

The combination of California lemon and shiso create a bright, citrusy, yet tea-like tonic. The synergistic combination of these two ingredients offers flavors of green plum wine, wild oregano, tarragon and citron with a slight minty aroma. Great for both hot and cold brew.

Learn more about the Rishi Herb Lab Blends
Ingredients: organic lemon, organic green shiso
Name: Shiso Lemon

Flavor: A calming ensemble of chamomile with hints of refreshing citrus and mint
Description: Our signature chamomile blend highlights golden Croatian chamomile blossoms that are masterfully paired with soothing herbal counterpoints of lemon verbena, lemongrass and spearmint. Striking the perfect balance of savory and floral, Chamomile Medley is a delightful way to relax and refresh the palate at the end of a meal.
Ingredients: Organic chamomile flowers, organic lemongrass, organic lemon verbena, organic spearmint
Name: Chamomile Medley

Flavor: Naturally sweet and refreshing  pure African rooibos with a  deep red, nectar-like infusion
Description: null
Ingredients: Organic rooibos
Name: Rooibos

Flavor: Inviting eucalyptus and sweet, honey like quince charm even the coldest of days with this soothing seasonal blend.
Description: Quince Eucalyptus was created especially for cold winters. This limited edition seasonal Herb Lab Series highlights sweet quince, refreshing eucalyptus, spicy ginger, punchy black pepper and vibrant yuzu. Don't let the winter doldrums get you down!
Ingredients: Organic quince, organic lemon peel, organic linden flowers and leaves, organic eucalyptus, organic peaches, organic yuzu, organic ginger, organic lemon myrtle, organic black pepper, organic hawthorn leaves, essential tangerine oil.
Name: Quince Eucalyptus

Flavor: An exquisite blend of revitalizing and pungent turmeric balanced with classic chai spices and enriched with roasted coconut, sumptuous vanilla bean, and creamy sarsaparilla root.
Description: This exquisite caffeine-free chai highlights the lovely golden color and revitalizing pungency of turmeric in a seductive blend of roasted coconut, sumptuous vanilla bean and creamy sarsaparilla root. Classic chai notes of exotic cardamom, zesty ginger and spicy black pepper create irresistible depth. Turmeric Chai can be brewed like tea or used as a foundation for inventive chai recipes with nut milks, black tea or even rosewater.
Ingredients: Organic coconut, organic turmeric, organic ginger root, organic cardamom, organic cinnamon, organic sarsaparilla root, organic vanilla bean, organic black pepper, natural lychee flavor, natural rose extract
Name: Turmeric Chai

Flavor: A rich cup highlighting the cordial like body and immune-boosting elderberry balanced with ginger and licorice root.
Description:
This organic botanical blend offers a soothing, cordial-like body that highlights immune-boosting elderberry. Elderberry has been used for millennia in folk remedies and has an elegant tannin structure and sumptuous flavor. Organic ginger root fortifies the blend; organic licorice root lends a natural sweetness, while essential oil of grapefruit provides a pleasant brightness at the finish.

Looking for Elderberry Healer Sachets? Find them here.
Ingredients: Organic ginger root, organic elderberries, organic hibiscus flowers, organic licorice root, essential grapefruit oil.
Name: Elderberry Healer

Flavor: floral and spicy aromatic complexity, refreshing and calming adaptogenic function with a pronounced fruity sweetness
Description:
Tulsi is renowned for its calming effect, known to offer cognitive and memory-enhancing properties as well as being anti-inflammatory and immune-boosting. Tulsi, or Holy Basil, is one of the cornerstone adaptogens of Ayurvedic herbology. Astragalus has been used for thousands of years in Traditional Chinese Medicine as a tonifying herb, referencing its ability to nourish and strengthen the vigor and immunity. Astragalus, with its unique and milky-sweet taste, is applied frequently in times of illness. Used as a balancing and harmonizing herb in Traditional Chinese Medicine, Gan Cao, or licorice root, replenishes Qi (life energy) and complements this blend by way of flavor and function. Licorice root has a pleasing and thirst-quenching taste, and it feels soothing on the throat in dry weather. The potent combination of these classic herbs from various global healing modalities yields amazing aroma, refreshing energy and a delicious spice and sweetness.

Learn more about the benefits of the ingredients in this Rishi Herb Lab Blend.
Ingredients: organic ginger root, organic tulsi, organic licorice root, organic astragalus root, essential oil of  ginger, organic essential oil of geranium
Name: Tulsi Ginger

Flavor: An invigorating blend of  raspberry, burdock root and  mint with revitalizing ginseng
Description: A balanced combination of tangy berries, sweet roots and aromatic herbs infused with the vitality of ginseng. Burdock and dandelion roots add nutty accents and are known in traditional herbology to have a cleansing and recharging energy. This adaptogenic blend has an intriguing aromatic depth and refreshing raspberry mint finish.
Ingredients: Organic schisandra berries, organic dandelion root, organic burdock root, organic ginseng, organic rosehips, organic peppermint, organic licorice root, organic raspberries.
Name: Ginseng Detox

Flavor: Calming botanical and aromatic flowers with the relaxing effects of valerian root.
Description: Valerian Dream's wonderfully funky yet floral fragrance uses complementary nervine tonic herbs like cardamom and fennel that are known to aid in relaxation. Reset after a long day with this blend of botanicals designed to soothe the mind and body. Valerian is sweet with a perfumed, musky aroma and has been used for centuries in Europe as a bedtime tea. Dream away.
Ingredients: Organic valerian root, organic cardamom, organic fennel seed, organic licorice root, organic strawberries, organic spearmint, natural rose extract, organic rose petals, essential orange oil
Name: Valerian Dream

Flavor: wintergreen, pine, fresh flowers and lilac
Description:
Flowers and blossoms have been used for centuries to scent tea, as well as combined into herbal blends. The tradition of scenting tea with flowers such as jasmine, lotus, pomelo blossoms and other types of flowers is a time-honored craft. Simple infusions of dried flowers were consumed frequently during the Song Dynasty (960-1279 CE) as a purifying palette cleanser before the tea ceremony and really came into vogue during the Ming Dynasty (1368-1644 CE) when many types of flower-scented teas were created. Chrysanthemums from Korea are prized as one of the most flavorful types of chrysanthemum that can be selected for tea. These blossoms are grown for us in Hadong region of Korea and have a classic taste with core bitter-sweetness and the complex aroma of wintergreen, pine, honey and spring blossoms.

Four Seasons Spring Oolong is a lightly oxidized, tightly rolled, ball shaped oolong tea sourced from our partners of twenty years in Taiwan's central highlands. This oolong is crafted from the Si Ji Chun 四季春, or literally “Four Seasons Spring,” cultivar. The tea has a golden-green, medium-bodied infusion with very floral, long-lasting aromatics evocative of fresh gardenia, freesia blossoms and tropical fruits.

When Korean chrysanthemums are combined with this oolong, the aroma and flavor experience is transformed into something really special and energetic. In Korean herbalist practice, chrysanthemum is regarded as cooling, purifying and a natural source of antioxidants. Chrysanthemum flowers produce various types of flavonoids, which results in anti-inflammatory effects. The simple blend of fresh, green oolong and Korean chrysanthemum creates a whole new bouquet of fragrance—heady and aromatic—nothing else is needed.
Ingredients: oolong tea and chrysanthemum
Name: Chrysanthemum Oolong

Flavor: Distinctive flavor and heady aroma, calms the body and soothes the digestive system
Description:
Our pure peppermint leaves hail from the Pacific Northwest, where certain cultivars are prized as some of the most aromatic and potent in the world. We seek a specific strain of Mentha x piperita that offers a bright candy cane flavor.

On the go? Check out our Pacific Peppermint Tea Bags.
Ingredients: Organic peppermint
Name: Peppermint

Flavor: Euphoric aromatics and energy of saffron, eucalyptus and cardamom with dynamic structure and balance from citrus peels, medicinal roots and fennel.
Description:
Our saffron bitters ""digestivo"" blend is based on ancient Amari recipes from Italy. Amari (singular Amaro) is a category of bitter herbal liqueurs from Italy that have hundreds if not thousands of years of botanical wisdom and food cultural relevance. Back in the days when the kitchen and garden were the people's doctor and pharmacy, herbal liqueurs were concocted by local herbalists in monasteries and apothecaries to ward off the evils and ailments of the day.

Today, herbal liqueurs find their way into craft cocktails and bars all over the world and are ever more popular for their naturally exotic aromatics. Our Herb Lab Series Saffron Bitters is inspired by the complexity and bracingly bitter edge of Fernet Branca with its heady eucalyptus and exotic herbal notes and by La Strega which is noted for its bitter sweet and golden liquor infused with Angelica and saffron.

Rishi's Saffron Bitters is an ode to herbalists' and mixologists' creativity and passion. It can be infused as a herbal tea or cold brewed in vodka for 10 days and filtered to create an herbal liqueur of your own.

Our blend features the aromatic fruits and rinds of rare citrus and bergamots as well as top grade saffron from Afghanistan and a plethora of rarified quality botanicals that create the balance and energy of this amazing blend.
Ingredients: Organic bergamot peel, organic lemon peel, organic fennel, organic cardamom, angelica root, organic sarsaparilla root, organic turmeric root, organic eucalyptus, saffron.
Name: Saffron Bitters

Flavor: Sweet, soothing West Cape  rooibos balanced by exotic  masala spices
Description: Rich red rooibos, along with sweet cinnamon and aromatic cardamom, impart a familiar taste to this caffeine free chai blend. Enlivening star anise mixes with assertive ginger, floral and pungent black pepper and the roasted coffee-like character of ramón nut to produce a truly original anytime chai. With its dark red infusion, West Cape Chai is the perfect base for lattes and innovative café drinks.
Ingredients: Organic rooibos, organic cinnamon, organic ginger root, organic cardamom, organic ramon nut, organic star anise, organic licorice root, organic fennel seed, organic black pepper, organic cloves, organic peppermint
Name: West Cape Chai

Flavor: Premium organic peppermint blended with floral-scented green tea
Description: Moroccan Mint is a traditional green tea enjoyed throughout the world, balancing the bright taste of peppermint with lively green tea that can be sweetened to taste. Our version features jasmine green tea for an aromatic complexity not found in common Moroccan Mint teas.
Ingredients: Organic green tea with jasmine, organic peppermint
Name: Moroccan Mint

Flavor: Mellow with a sweet mint flavor,  a pleasant toasty note and  hints of chocolate
