Ingredients: Organic white tea, organic quince, natural peach flavor, organic peaches, organic essential orange oil, essential tangerine oil
Name: Peach Blossom

Flavor: complex fruitiness and tropical flowers with notes of honey corn silk, rose and melon
Description:
Origin: Jinggu County, Yunnan Province, China
Cultivar: Changye Bai Hao, Jinggu Da Bai, Xue Ya #100, Da Huang Ya
Harvest: March 25-30, 2021
Elevation: 1,400m

This micro-batch of Silver Needles was grown and produced in China’s Yunnan province. White tea is not traditional to this region and has only been made here in recent decades. Just like Silver Needles from the heritage origin of Fuding, this tea is comprised of pure, individually plucked tea buds harvested during the famous Mingqian period in early spring. The unique cultivars in this blend offer a range of amino acid, polyphenol and aromatic complexities that are not found in the average tea garden. The older roots provide ample nourishment to the plants and yield a complex fruity and nectar-like flavor profile not found in traditional Fuding Silver Needles, which emphasizes a savory, umami taste.
Ingredients: Organic white tea
Name: Yunnan Silver Needles Cultivar Blend

Flavor: White peach, lily, fresh cassia, deep umami, lively, complex structure and quenching presence
Description:
Origin: Ramché, Bokré & Nigalé Divisions, Jun Chiyabari, Hile, Nepal
Cultivar: Mixed clonal  
Elevation: 1850m
Harvest: March 24, 2021

Jun Chiyabari is located in Hile, a region nestled in the Himalayas in eastern Nepal, due south of Mt. Everest with stunning views of Kangchenjunga. Himalayan White is one of the first harvests of the year from the Ramché, Bokré & Nigalé Division. This style of tea follows a processing method very similar to White Peony (Bai Mu Dan), a popular style of white tea made of young tea leaves and silvery unopened leaf buds, also known as two leaves and a bud. The tea is skillfully withered for a long period of time both indoors and outdoors, at room temperature and with cooler air, then lightly dried in an oven. When stored properly, this tea will age beautifully, and features tasting notes of white peach, lily, fresh cassia, deep umami, lively, complex structure and quenching presence.
Ingredients: Organic white tea
Name: Himalayan White J3B
Origin: Jun Chiyabari Tea Garden, Hile, Nepal

Description:
Origin: Fuding town, Fujian province, China
Cultivar: Fuding Da Hao
Elevation: 500 - 700m
Harvest: March 28th, 2018

Fuding Silver Needles is a heritage white tea from the coastal town of Fuding, a famous white tea producing region situated on mist-enshrouded mountainsides that overlook an estuary leading out to the sea. The maritime air and oceanic mineral soils rich in basalt are said to lend a savory quality to the white teas grown here. This special batch was harvested during the Mingqian period in early spring, the most prized harvest of the year made from the first tea buds that sprout in the new season.

These Mingqian buds are thickly coated in a downy white coat of sweet trichomes and are highly concentrated in amino acids and other nutrients that were stored in the plant’s roots during winter. The result is a sublime and elegant balance of savory umami and floral sweetness with hints of wheatgrass, orchid, and maple sap. High-class white teas like these also have the potential to age gracefully, such as this limited 2018 Vintage.
Ingredients: Organic white tea
Name: Fuding Silver Needles Vintage 2018

Flavor: Peach blossom, magnolia, wild honey, spring herbs and aromas of fresh cassia
Description:
Origin: Fuding, Fujian Province, China
Cultivar: Fuding Da Hao “Big Hair” & Fuding Da Bai “Big White”
Elevation: 500-700m
Harvest: April 1-5, 2021

White Peony King, or Bai Mu Dan Wang, is the grand cru of White Peony tea. From the middle of March through the first week of April the tea producers who farm the gardens in the hills above Fuding in Fujian province keenly monitor the weather. The prime buds of tea leaf must be harvested during brief windows of sunshine amid the generally foggy coastal air. The earliest plucks are taken literally in the first few days and are reserved for Fuding Silver Needles and White Peony King. This special batch was harvested during the Mingqian period in early spring, the most prized harvest of the year. In this vintage of White Peony King, observe a delicate golden infusion with a silky, umami rich body with aromas of wildflowers.
Ingredients: Organic white tea
Name: White Peony King

Flavor: Fresh floral bouquet of iris and orchids, hint of ripe peach with a brisk and elegant tannin structure
Description:
Origin: Ramché & Bokré Divisions, Jun Chiyabari, Hile, Nepal
Cultivar: Mixed clonal
Elevation: 1850m
Harvest: April 5, 2021

Jun Chiyabari is located in Hile, a region nestled in the Himalayas in eastern Nepal, due south of Mt. Everest with stunning views of Kangchenjunga. Himalayan White is one of the first harvests of the year from the Ramché & Bokré Divisions. This style of tea follows a processing method very similar to White Peony (Bai Mu Dan), a popular style of white tea made of young tea leaves and silvery unopened leaf buds, also known as two leaves and a bud. The tea is skillfully withered for a long period of time both indoors and outdoors, at room temperature and with cooler air, then lightly dried in an oven. When stored properly, this tea will age beautifully, and features fresh floral bouquet of iris and orchids, hint of ripe peach with a brisk and elegant tannin structure. This tea has the perfect example of the right strike of baking and fixed rosy that keeps the floral and sweetness.
Ingredients: Organic white tea
Name: Himalayan White J11A
Origin: Jun Chiyabari Tea Garden, Hile, Nepal

Flavor: Pure white tea with mellow-sweet notes of fresh hay and accents of honey and nectar
Description: White Peony, also known by the traditional name Bai Mu Dan, is a popular style of white tea made of young tea leaves and silvery unopened leaf buds. Our White Peony comes from Zhenghe town in Fujian Province, the original birthplace of white tea centuries ago. Distinguished by being plucked in ""budsets"" of one or two leaves and a bud, this tea has a sophisticated mouthfeel with a slightly stronger body than Silver Needles. A gentle and slow air-dry withering process results in a brilliant amber infusion with a honey-like viscosity and mild flavor that pairs well with food.
Ingredients: Organic white tea
Name: White Peony

Description:
Origin: Jinggu county, Yunnan province, China
Cultivar: Da Huang Ya “Big Yellow Bud”
Elevation: 1,400m
Harvest:  March 25-30, 2021

This tea is from the rare single-cultivar Da Huang Ya, or “Big Yellow Buds,” grown in Jinggu county, Yunnan. Several years ago we worked with partners to graft the Da Huang Ya cultivar onto older existing rootstock, a technique used in wine cultivation. We’ve been thrilled to see the successful results as the plants spring back with renewed vigor. Da Huang Ya yields large, plump buds that provide a long-lasting sweetness with a unique amino acid profile, creating a nuanced savory character. The infusion is imbued with the most radiant yellow-gold tints. This year’s vintage has subtly sweet notes of floral nectar, honey and wildflowers.
Ingredients: Organic white tea
Name: Yunnan Silver Needles Single Cultivar Da Huang Ya
Link: Yunnan Silver Needles Single Cultivar Da Huang Ya

Flavor: Reserve white tea with a sublime, sweet flavor and rich, savory finish
Description: Widely esteemed for its delicate appearance, elegant sweetness and noble character, Silver Needles tea is comprised of pure, individually plucked tea buds harvested only in the early springtime. Our Silver Needles is unique in that it is sourced from Menghai and Mengku broad leaf varietal ancient tea tree groves in the remote, mountainous Yunnan Province of China. Like old grape vines, ancient tea trees yield complexities not found in other tea cultivars. This tea's sweet, nectar-like flavor and fruity aroma are examples of that varietal expression. Silver Needles is exceedingly rare and beloved by tea connoisseurs.
Ingredients: Organic white tea
Name: Silver Needles

Description: The sweet, smooth, fruity, and floral aromas of the autumn flush are always in complete harmony. This pure blend of fresh Darjeeling autumn teas is a balanced cup of tea. When you start sipping, sweet flavors of candied orange greet the palate with a hint of muskmelon that flows throughout the entire duration of the cup. Light floral hints also begin to appear that adds a rounded character to the cup. The aftertaste of red berries lingers on.
Ingredients: NA
Name: NA

Description: Established in 1881, located in the heart of Kurseong, the Giddapahar tea estate is one of the oldest plantations in Darjeeling. Known for producing characteristic chinary cups, this 2021 first flush cup is a special one. As you sip, the unique note of greens arrives at your palate. Around the middle, hints of unripe tree fruit with flavors of cantaloupes shore up, rendering intensity to the liquor. Towards the end, delicate notes of green almond linger on, a delightful experience of first flush chinary black tea.
Ingredients: NA
Name: NA

Description: As old as the 16th century, we have blended these fragrant rose petals with whole leaf green tea to provide you a cup that is soothing and incredibly flavorful. The fusion of rose and green tea produces sweet and warm aromas; Perfect to sip all day long.
Ingredients: NA
Name: NA

Description: Located just one and a half hours away from our facility, the 122-year-old Goomtee tea estate, from majestic Kurseong valley is famed for producing exquisite Darjeeling Spring teas. This year's Goomtee Spring Chinary Black plucked from the vintage chinary bushes, is a firework of taste and texture. As you begin sipping, delicate notes of unripe tree fruit coat your palate. Towards the middle, notes of sweet vegetative flavors and muskmelon entwined with subtle undertones of candied rhubarb arrive, adding a rounded feel to the cup. The green papaya aftertaste lingers making for a distinguished finish.
Ingredients: NA
Name: NA

Description: Located in the Barak valley of south Assam, this tea garden is said to be in existence around the 1880s but the official records suggest 1913. A lush green plantation, this garden is home to rich thriving biodiversity. Famed for producing top-notch summer malts, this finest Indian single estate tea is exquisite. As you sip, notes of dates and malts arrive on the palate. Hints of wet wood encircle around the edges with aromas of nuts arriving towards the end, a memorable experience of Indian Summer Harvest 2021!
Ingredients: NA
Name: NA

Description: From Kurseong Darjeeling at 4864 feet, since 1881, the Giddapahar tea estate is renowned for producing some of the best Muscatels. Plucked meticulously from a dedicated section exclusive for Teabox, these rare Muscatels are prepared from 100-year-old chinary bushes. Located one and a half hours away, we have procured these teas fresh from Giddapahar. Gorgeous amber-hued, medium-bodied, robust with apricots and cherries, the liquor envelopes the palate right at the start. Notes of peaches with subtle oaky hints encircle towards the middle with nutty accents in the aftertaste. This Giddapahar Summer Muscatel Black, the 2021 second flush from Darjeeling, is a real stand-out this summer.
Ingredients: NA
Name: NA

Description: Meaning ‘home of the birds', Singbulli tea estate is located about 40 kms from Darjeeling. Planted in 1924, this estate lies amongst picturesque monasteries and pure, crystal-clear lakes. Year after year, Singbulli is famed for producing exceptional Oolong teas. We have procured this batch, fresh from the finely plucked young, clonal AV2 varietals, from the Tingling division, at 4500 feet, of the estate. An organic offering from this revered tea garden, this cup is immensely smooth with a delicate floral texture and notes of Asiatic lilies and fuchsia peonies. Luscious fruity hints like muskmelon and peaches ebb towards the middle while ending on a hint of radiant camellias. Steep it again and add ice for an even refreshing experience. The freshest and aromatic cup of first flush 2021 from Darjeeling you ever have!
Ingredients: NA
Name: NA

Description: One of the specialties of the Bermiok Tea Estate is this exquisite black tea produced during the autumn flush. It's a medium-bodied cup of tea that starts with subtle tart-sweet notes like nectarines. Hints of nuts and wood with a slight earthy nuance grow towards the middle, adding a distinguished texture to the liquor. The aftertaste is stone-fruity.

Description: Situated in Karbi Anglong, the Banaspaty tea garden is one of the first certified organic tea gardens of Assam. Meaning flora, fauna, and trees, Banaspaty is awarded for being the first 'Elephant Friendly Tea Garden' in Assam. This lush green tea garden also spots Rhinos as it is near Kaziranga National Park. Famed for producing top-notch quality teas, the rich alluvial soil of the Brahmaputra valley gives their tea a unique character. We have sampled this gorgeous Indian single malt, the golden tippy orthodox tea. Full-bodied, brisk with exquisite notes of malt arrives right from the start. Hints of yellow raisins encircle around the middle with notes of stone fruits coming in the aftertaste. An immersive experience of Indian Summer Harvest 2021!

Description: Samabeong tea estate is one of the highest and remotest tea gardens of Darjeeling. Situated in Kalimpong and surrounded by the dense Neora Valley forests, this estate is home to a diverse range of native and migratory Himalayan birds. Known to produce distinguished first flush cups, this tea is organically cultivated at an altitude of 6000 ft. from a section exclusively planted with young, clonal tea plants. This cup is light-bodied and smooth that starts with soft floral tones! Towards the middle, tropical fruity flavors akin to cantaloupes appear. Zesty citron with sweet notes of candied pear can be perceived towards the end, making it a remarkable cup of First flush 2021.

We have traveled to this iconic tea estate to sample this freshly made Indian single estate tea. Medium-bodied, brisk with notes of Mirabelle plums and hints of nuts and red berries, experience a splendid cup of Indian Summer Harvest 2021!

An organic plantation that is situated in Mirik Darjeeling, we have procured this rare Muscatel picked at 5000 feet. This Indian summer flush 2021 delicacy is medium-bodied, brisk, and fruity. As you begin sipping, notes of Muscat grapes and luscious peach arrive on the palate and stay for the entire length of the cup. Notes of cedar and chestnuts encircle towards the middle with delicious accents of Rainer cherries in the aftertaste. A memorable cup of second flush 2021!

The typical smokiness never leaves the cup making it one to relish and admire for a long time.

Description: One of the oldest tea estates in Darjeeling, standing tall since 1899, the Goomtee tea estate is situated in the south of Kurseong. Grown at 4000 feet under the mist of hills, we have traveled to this estate and sampled this exquisite Muscatel. This Indian single estate tea is medium-bodied, pleasant, and fruity. From the start, notes of nectarines and apricots can be felt along with hints of musk. Notes of grapes come towards the middle that stays on the palate till the end. The aftertaste is tart-fruity, an exceptional cup of Indian Summer Flush 2021!

Description: One of the most iconic gardens in Darjeeling, established in 1885, the Castleton tea estate is where the Muscatels were first made. It was our chief master taster Mr. Arun Gomden who made the first batch of these elusive teas. The Muscatels from Castleton are sought after by tea aficionados around the world. Situated at 6000 ft. and plucked from a designated section of the estate, this tea is made only during summer flush. Located just an hour and a half away from our facility, we have procured this rare Muscatel fresh. As you sip this medium-bodied tea, delectable notes of peaches and prunes arrive. Notes of cedar and hazelnuts circle toward the middle with accents of Muscat grapes in the end. An unforgettable experience of Indian Second Harvest 2021, a true connoisseur's delight!

Known for producing good quality chinary teas, this 2021 first flush tea is a fresh and brisk black tea. Distinct raw fruity notes grow into prominence as you begin sipping this cup. The aromas of cantaloupes emerge towards the middle with lingering raw guava hints in the aftertaste. A memorable experience of first flush chinary black tea!

Description: Suspended in the clouds, as our procurement teas source the finest white picked from high elevations, this blend is our representation of Darjeeling's ethereal beauty. Description: Lapacho is also known under the name Taheebo, Pau d'arco, or Tree of Life. The infusion is made of the inner lining of the bark of the Lapacho tree. The tree grows high in the Andes of the South American rainforest. The Lapacho's inner bark was one of the main medicines used by the Incas and has been used for over 1,000 years by the Callawaya tribe, descendants of the Incas. It is said to have a positive effect on the immune system. However, this was not confirmed in clinical trials. Lapacho makes a pale yellow infusion and has a hint of spicy notes. The recommended method of preparation is to let the tea simmer on the stove for 5 minutes, and then steep it for another 15 minutes.
Ingredients: Ingredients: Lapacho, aka Tree of Life, aka Taheebo, natural orange flavour

Description: Gyokuro is known as Japan's best green tea. It is made from single buds that are picked only in April/May. In an effort to develop increased chlorophyll (making tea dark green) and reduced the tannin (giving a sweeter flavour with no bitterness), the tea is covered with black curtains or bamboo and straw shades for 3 weeks in early spring. Immediately after plucking the leaves are taken to the factory and steamed for about 30 minutes to seal in the flavor and arrest fermentation. Next they are fluffed with hot air and pressed and dried to 30% moisture content. Repeated rolling takes place until the tea develops long thin dark green needles at which time it is finally dried to a 4-6% moisture content. Gyokuro has been referred to as ""history, philosophy and art in a single cup."" Usually steeped in a kyusu (special Japanese teapot) and served in Japanese cups.
Ingredients: Ingredients: Japanese style gyokuro, certified organic
Name: Organic Gyokuro
Time: Recommended Drinking Time: Gyokuro is a great green tea for any time of the day.

Description: Lapacho is also known under the name Taheebo, Pau d'arco, or Tree of Life. The infusion is made of the inner lining of the bark of the Lapacho tree. The tree grows high in the Andes of the South American rainforest. The Lapacho's inner bark was one of the main medicines used by the Incas and has been used for over 1,000 years by the Callawaya tribe, descendants of the Incas. It is said to have a positive effect on the immune system. However, this was not confirmed in clinical trials. Lapacho makes a pale yellow infusion and has a hint of spicy notes. The recommended method of preparation is to let the tea simmer on the stove for 5 minutes, and then steep it for another 15 minutes.
Ingredients: Ingredients: Lapacho from South America
Name: Lapacho - plain

Description: Golden Pur-erh has been aged for five years. This aging process in a relatively high humidity environment has mellowed the elemental character of the tea when compared to young Pu-erh (aged about 1 year). As with wine, young pu-erh is considered the least valuable whereas pu-erh 5 years or older is more highly prized. Interestingly, the taste of pu-erh becomes more mellow with age and perhaps more acceptable to the western palate. Hint of mustiness with a bit of earthy character sometimes described as old or elemental. Compared to young pu-erh this tea is quite mild.
Ingredients: Ingredients: Organic Pu-Erh from China
Name: Golden Pu-Erh (organic)
Time: Recommended Drinking Time: Organic Golden Pu-Erh is a great black tea for any time of day.

Description: Beautiful every-day Keemun, that has all the typical characteristics of a fine Keemun tea. In China, this tea is known as Gong Fu tea, which means 'great labour'. The infusion is of deep burgundy colour. It has an earthy bold flavour, and takes milk very well.
Ingredients: Ingredients: Premium China black tea.

Description: Green Rooibos originates just like red rooibos in South Africa. The only difference lies in its manufacturing process. While red rooibos is bruised and oxidized, green rooibos is treated to avoid oxidation. This leaves the leaves closer to the natural state. While not certified organic, our Rooibos is grown organically. The resulting infusion is lighter bodied and less citric-piney. This rooibos blend with ginger and lemon flavour is light and refreshing.
Ingredients: Ingredients: Finest green Rooibos from South Africa, ginger, calendula petals, and natural flavour
Name: Ginger Lemon Rooibos

Description: These rose petals are the perfect blending ingredient. The fragrant leaves can be added to any tea - adding a layer of sweet rose. Description: This tea contains a high percentage of Gamma-Aminobutyric Acid (GABA), known for having a calming effect on the nervous system. It has a wonderful, soothing flavour.  Tea plants are known to produce leaves especially high in glutamic acid. About two weeks prior to plucking, GABA oolong leaves are partially shaded, which causes increased production of this substance. During the oxidation-phase of production, all oxygen is replaced with nitrogen gas, whose presence causes the glutamic acid to be converted to Gamma-Aminobutyric Acid. To meet Japanese standards and be labeled GABA Tea, the finished product must contain at least 150mg of GABA per 100g dry weight.
Ingredients: Ingredients: Premium Oolong containing gaba from Taiwan
Name: Gaba Oolong

Description: Green Rooibos comes from the same plant as the popular ""Rooibos"" (aka Red Bush, Red Rooibos). It is actually nothing other than the unoxidized (unfermented) form of Red Rooibos. Green Rooibos is handpicked in the summer, and then immediately allowed to dry without exposing it to the sun. Green Rooibos has many of therapeutic properties available in regular rooibos. Due to the elimination of oxidization the levels of flavanoids and anti-oxidants are boosted.

The nets permit only some of the sunlight to reach the plant. Production of shaded tea comes very close to the natural light conditions of the wild tea plant. Description: AKA Rubus idaeus - Raspberry Leaves come from the Rose Family. Please note that these are the Raspberry Leaves only - the infusion does not taste like Raspberries. Alternately, please refer to our Raspberry Tea (Flavoured Black Tea). Medical Properties: It is one of the most popular pregnancy herbs because it has both relaxing and toning or astringent actions, with a particular affinity for the uterus. The astringent and stimulating properties help to strengthen and tone up the uterine and pelvic muscles, while the relaxing and more soothing properties relax the uterus at the same time. A raspberry leaf decoction is also used to relieve diarrhea. Externally, the leaves are used as an eyewash for conjunctivitis, a mouthwash for mouth sores, wounds, or excessive vaginal discharge. Raspberry leaves are also useful in treating premenstrual discomforts, bed-wetting, morning sickness and sore throats.
Ingredients: Ingredients: Raspberry Leaves
Name: Raspberry Leaf

Description: Gyokuro is known as Japan's best green tea. It is made from single buds that are picked only in April/May. In an effort to develop increased chlorophyll (making tea dark green) and reduced the tannin (giving a sweeter flavour with no bitterness), the tea is covered with black curtains or bamboo and straw shades for 3 weeks in early spring. Immediately after plucking the leaves are taken to the factory and steamed for about 30 minutes to seal in the flavor and arrest fermentation. Next they are fluffed with hot air and pressed and dried to 30% moisture content. Repeated rolling takes place until the tea develops long thin dark green needles at which time it is finally dried to a 4-6% moisture content. Gyokuro has been referred to as ""history, philosophy and art in a single cup."" Usually steeped in a kyusu (special Japanese teapot) and served in Japanese cups.
Ingredients: Ingredients: Japanese style gyokuro, certified organic
Name: Organic Gyokuro
Time: Recommended Drinking Time: Gyokuro is a great green tea for any time of the day.
